Part.Title: Remittance basis of taxation: special mixed fund rules

P1para.Text: Chapter A1 of Part 14 of ITA 2007 (remittance basis) is amended as follows.
In section 809Q (sections 809L and 809P: transfers from mixed funds), after subsection (1) insert—

P2para.Text: But this section must be read subject to section 809RA.

P1para.Text: After section 809R insert—

P1group.Title: Special mixed fund rules for certain employment cases

P2para.Text: This section applies if—

P3para.Text: an individual has general earnings from an employment for a tax year,
those earnings include both general earnings within section 15(1) of ITEPA 2003 (“section 15(1) earnings”) and general earnings within section 26(1) of that Act (“section 26(1) earnings”),

at least some of the section 15(1) earnings, or sums deriving (wholly or in part, and directly or indirectly) from at least some of the section 15(1) earnings, are paid into an account in that tax year at a time (a “relevant time”) when the account is a qualifying account of the individual, and

at least some of the section 26(1) earnings, or sums deriving (wholly or in part, and directly or indirectly) from at least some of the section 26(1) earnings, are also paid into the account in that tax year at a relevant time.

P2para.Text: If this section applies, the composition of each transfer made from the account in that tax year at a relevant time is to be determined as follows—
Step 1 Suppose that all the condition A transfers made from the account in the tax year at a relevant time had been a single transfer made from the account at the end of the tax year.

Step 2 Suppose that all the other transfers made from the account in the tax year at a relevant time had been a single offshore transfer made at the end of the tax year immediately after the single transfer mentioned in step 1.
Step 3 Applying those suppositions—

Para.Text: find under section 809Q(3) the extent to which the single transfer mentioned in step 1 is of the individual’s income or chargeable gains, and
find under section 809R(4) the content of the single offshore transfer mentioned in step 2.

P2para.Text: Step 4 Each transfer made from the account in the tax year at a relevant time is to be treated as containing the specified proportion of each kind of income or capital contained in the relevant deemed transfer.
“The specified proportion” is the amount of the transfer divided by the amount of the relevant deemed transfer.
“The relevant deemed transfer” is—

Para.Text: if the transfer is a condition A transfer, the single transfer mentioned in step 1, and
otherwise, the single offshore transfer mentioned in step 2.

P2para.Text: “The relevant deemed transfer” is—

Para.Text: if the transfer is a condition A transfer, the single transfer mentioned in step 1, and
otherwise, the single offshore transfer mentioned in step 2.

P2para.Text: Subsection (2) applies in determining the composition of a transfer for the purposes of sections 809Q and 809R but it does not otherwise affect the date on which a transfer is considered to occur for the purposes of this Chapter.

If the tax year is the tax year in which the account becomes a qualifying account, for the purpose of applying section 809Q(3) in relation to the single transfer mentioned in step 1 of subsection (2), treat the part of the tax year falling before the qualifying date for the account as a separate tax year.
If the account ceases to be a qualifying account of the individual during the tax year other than as a result of a breach of the deposit rule—

P3para.Text: subsection (2) has effect as if references to the end of the tax year were to the end of the day on which the account ceases to be a qualifying account, and

for the purpose of applying section 809Q(3) in relation to the single transfer mentioned in step 1 of subsection (2), treat the part of the tax year falling after the day mentioned in paragraph (a) as a separate tax year.

P2para.Text: A transfer from the account is a “condition A transfer” if and to the extent that—

P3para.Text: condition A in section 809L is met, and
either—

P4para.Text: the property or consideration for the service is (wholly or in part), or derives (wholly or in part, and directly or indirectly) from, the transfer, or
the transfer, or anything deriving (wholly or in part, and directly or indirectly) from the transfer, is used as mentioned in section 809L(3)(c).

P2para.Text: A transfer from the account is an “other transfer” if and to the extent that it is not a condition A transfer.
Treat a transfer as an “other transfer” if and to the extent that, at the end of the tax year—

P3para.Text: it is not a condition A transfer, and
on the basis of the best estimate that can reasonably be made at that time, it will not become a condition A transfer.

P2para.Text: If the account ceases to be a qualifying account of the individual during the tax year other than as a result of a breach of the deposit rule, subsection (8) has effect as if the reference to the end of the tax year were to the end of the day on which the account ceases to be a qualifying account.
“Qualifying account” and “the qualifying date” for an account are defined in section 809RB.
For the purposes of this section and sections 809RB to 809RD—

P3para.Text: “employment” is to be read in accordance with section 4(1) of ITEPA 2003, and includes an office (as read in accordance with section 5(3) of that Act),
whether general earnings are “for” a tax year is to be determined as for the purposes of the employment income Parts of ITEPA 2003 (see section 3(2) of that Act),
a reference to anything “paid into” an account includes anything credited to the account by whatever means, and
references to a breach of the deposit rule are to be read in accordance with section 809RC.

P2para.Text: An individual may by notice to the Commissioners nominate an account to be a qualifying account of the individual for the purposes of section 809RA.
The notice must specify the qualifying date for the account.
“The qualifying date” for the account is the first date on which there is paid into the account sums falling within subsection (4) which (in total) are more than £10.

A sum falls within this subsection if it is, or derives wholly (whether directly or indirectly) from, general earnings of the individual from an employment for a tax year which is a relevant tax year in relation to the employment.

A tax year is a “relevant” tax year in relation to an employment if the general earnings which the individual has for the tax year from the employment include both general earnings within section 15(1) of ITEPA 2003 and general earnings within section 26(1) of that Act.
The individual may withdraw the nomination by giving a further notice to the Commissioners, specifying the date with effect from which the nomination is withdrawn.
A notice under subsection (1) or (6) must be in writing and include such information as the Commissioners may reasonably require.
A notice under subsection (1) or (6) must be given no later than—

P3para.Text: 31 January in the tax year following the tax year in which falls, as the case may be—

P4para.Text: the qualifying date for the account, or
the date with effect from which the nomination is withdrawn, or

P3para.Text: such later date as the Commissioners may allow.

P2para.Text: If an individual nominates an account under this section, the account is a “qualifying account” of the individual throughout the period—

P3para.Text: beginning with the qualifying date, and
ending with the date before the earliest of the following dates—

P4para.Text: the date on which the account is closed or ceases to be an ordinary bank account held by and for the benefit of the individual (alone or jointly with others);
the date with effect from which the nomination is withdrawn under this section;
the qualifying date for another qualifying account of the individual;
6 April in a tax year in which there is a breach of the deposit rule which is not remedied or cannot be remedied;
6 April in a tax year for which the individual has no general earnings within section 26(1) of ITEPA 2003.

P2para.Text: The account is not to be a qualifying account at all if—

P3para.Text: at any time on the qualifying date, the account is not an ordinary bank account held by and for the benefit of the individual (alone or jointly with others), or
immediately before the qualifying date, the account has a credit balance of more than £10.

P2para.Text: The account is not to be a qualifying account at all if the qualifying date falls in a tax year—

P3para.Text: for which the individual has no general earnings within section 26(1) of ITEPA 2003, or
in which there is a breach of the deposit rule which is not remedied or cannot be remedied.

P2para.Text: Subsection (9)(b)(iv) or (11)(b) (as relevant) is to be ignored if the breach occurs on or after a date falling within subsection (9)(b)(i) to (iii).
If, apart from this subsection, an individual might have nominated two or more accounts for which the qualifying date would be the same, the individual may nominate only one of those accounts.

If, apart from this subsection, an account would be a qualifying account of two or more individuals at any time, it is not to be a qualifying account of either or any of them at that time or any other time.

For the purposes of this section an account is an “ordinary bank account” if it is a cash account in a bank (whether a current or savings account) where sums standing to the credit of the account from time to time represent a debt owed by the bank to the account-holder.
There is a breach of the deposit rule if a prohibited sum is paid into the account on or after the qualifying date.

A breach of the deposit rule is remedied if, within 30 days beginning with the day on which the individual became or ought reasonably to have become aware of the payment of the prohibited sum, the required amount is transferred out of the account by way of a single one-off transfer.
“The required amount” is an amount equal to—

P3para.Text: the prohibited sum, plus
all the other prohibited sums (if any) that have been paid into the account since that sum was paid in.

P2para.Text: If there are 3 breaches of the deposit rule in any 12 month period, subsection (2) does not apply to the third breach and, accordingly, the third breach cannot be remedied.
The payment of a prohibited sum (“the later prohibited sum”) into the account does not result in a breach of the deposit rule if—

P3para.Text: a breach resulting from an earlier payment of a prohibited sum into the account is remedied, and
the later prohibited sum is represented by the required amount in relation to that breach.

P2para.Text: A “prohibited sum” is anything other than a sum that is, or derives wholly (whether directly or indirectly) from, any of the following kinds of income or capital—

P3para.Text: general earnings of the individual from an employment for a tax year which is a relevant tax year in relation to the employment,
general earnings of the individual from an employment which consist of money and are paid in a tax year which is a relevant tax year in relation to the employment,

an amount of specific employment income which, by virtue of Part 6, 7 or 7A of ITEPA 2003 or any other enactment, counts as employment income of the individual in respect of an employment for a tax year which is a relevant tax year in relation to the employment,
interest on the account, or
consideration for the disposal of employment-related securities or employment-related securities options in the circumstances described in subsection (7).

P2para.Text: The circumstances are—

P3para.Text: the securities or options were acquired pursuant to a right or opportunity available by reason of an employment of the individual,
the disposal is or occurs in conjunction with, or as soon as reasonably practicable after, a relevant event involving those securities or options, and
the tax year in which the relevant event occurs is a relevant tax year in relation to the employment.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of subsection (7) each of the following is a “relevant event”—

P3para.Text: the acquisition mentioned in subsection (7)(a), and
any event on the occurrence of which an amount (if positive) counts as employment income by virtue of Part 7 of ITEPA 2003 or would do so but for—

P4para.Text: section 421E or 474 of that Act (exclusions: residence etc), or
an election under section 430 or 431 of that Act.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this section a tax year is a “relevant” tax year in relation to an employment if—

P3para.Text: the individual has general earnings from the employment for the tax year,
those earnings include both general earnings within section 15(1) of ITEPA 2003 (“section 15(1) earnings”) and general earnings within section 26(1) of that Act (“section 26(1) earnings”),

at least some of the section 15(1) earnings, or sums deriving (wholly or in part, and directly or indirectly) from at least some of the section 15(1) earnings, are paid into the account in the tax year, and

at least some of the section 26(1) earnings, or sums deriving (wholly or in part, and directly or indirectly) from at least some of the section 26(1) earnings, are also paid into the account in the tax year.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this section—

P3para.Text: “employment-related securities” has the meaning given in section 421B(8) of ITEPA 2003, and
“employment-related securities options” has the meaning given in section 471(5) of that Act.

P2para.Text: This section applies if the required amount in relation to a breach of the deposit rule was transferred out of the account in accordance with section 809RC(2).
Sections 809Q and 809R have effect as if—

P3para.Text: the intervening transactions had never taken place, and

each prohibited sum represented by the required amount had instead been transferred directly (at the time that sum was paid into the qualifying account) into the account or other property into which the required amount was transferred by virtue of the single one-off transfer.

P2para.Text: Each of the following is an “intervening transaction”—

P3para.Text: each payment into the qualifying account of a prohibited sum represented by the required amount, and
the single one-off transfer out of the qualifying account.

P2para.Text: If it is supposed under step 1 or 2 of section 809RA(2) that a single transfer had been made in the intervening period, re-apply section 809Q or 809R in relation to that transfer taking account of subsection (2).
“The intervening period” is the period—

P3para.Text: beginning with the day on which the breach occurred, and
ending with the day on which the single one-off transfer was made in accordance with section 809RC(2).

P2para.Text: If more than one transfer of a sum equal to the required amount was transferred out of the qualifying account within the 30-day grace period, the first of those transfers is assumed to be the single one-off transfer.
“The 30-day grace period” is the period of 30 days mentioned in section 809RC(2).

P1para.Text: The amendments made by Part 1 of this Schedule have effect in relation to earnings for the tax year 2013-14 and subsequent tax years.
The amendments made by Part 2 of this Schedule have effect in relation to transfers from a mixed fund that are made in the tax year 2013-14 or any subsequent tax year.

TitleBlock.Title: Remittance basis: exempt property

P1para.Text: Chapter A1 of Part 14 of ITA 2007 (remittance basis) is amended as follows.
In section 809X(3) (exempt property: public access rule), for “sections 809Z and 809Z1)” substitute “section 809Z)”.

P2para.Text: Section 809Y (property that ceases to be exempt property treated as remitted) is amended as follows.
In subsection (2), for “either” substitute “any”.
After subsection (4) insert—
Where exempt property has been lost, stolen or destroyed, the first and second cases do not apply in relation to the property during any period—

P3para.Text: beginning with the time at which it was lost, stolen or destroyed, and
(if lost or stolen) ending with the time at which it is recovered.

P2para.Text: The third case is where a compensation payment is released in respect of exempt property that has been lost, stolen or destroyed.
In subsection (6), after “exempt property” insert “by virtue of the first or second case”.

P1para.Text: After section 809YE insert—

P1group.Title: Exception to section 809Y: compensation taken offshore or invested

P2para.Text: Section 809Y(1) does not apply to property if—

P3para.Text: it ceases to be exempt property because a compensation payment in respect of it is released, and
conditions A and B are met.

P2para.Text: Condition A is that the whole of the compensation payment is taken offshore or used by a relevant person to make a qualifying investment within the period of 45 days beginning with the day on which the payment is released.

Condition B is that, if Condition A is satisfied wholly or in part by using the compensation payment to make a qualifying investment, the remittance basis user makes a claim for relief under subsection (4) on or before the first anniversary of the 31 January following the tax year in which the payment is released.

If section 809Y(1) does not apply to property by virtue of subsection (1), the income and gains treated under section 809X as not remitted to the United Kingdom continue to be treated after the compensation payment is released as not remitted to the United Kingdom even though the property has ceased to be exempt property.

But nothing in subsection (4) prevents anything done in relation to any part of the compensation payment after that payment is taken offshore (or used to make a qualifying investment) from counting as a remittance of the underlying income or gains to the United Kingdom at the time when the thing is done.

Treat the compensation payment as containing or deriving from an amount of each kind of income and gain mentioned in section 809Q(4)(a) to (h) equal to the amount of that kind of income or gain contained in the exempt property when it was brought to, or received or used in, the United Kingdom (as mentioned in section 809X).
Where Condition A was met by using the compensation payment to make a qualifying investment—

P3para.Text: the business investment provisions apply to the income and gains that continue, by virtue of subsection (4), to be treated
as not remitted as they apply to income or gains that are treated under section 809VA(2) as not remitted, and
if the investment was made using more than just the compensation payment, treat only the part of the investment made using the payment as “the investment” for the purposes of those provisions.

P2para.Text: Section 809Z (public access rule: general) is amended as follows.
In subsection (1), for “A to D” substitute “B and C”.
Omit subsection (2).
After subsection (8) insert—
But if the property is lost or stolen—

P3para.Text: the relevant period ends with the time at which it is lost or stolen, and
a new relevant period begins with its importation or the time at which it is recovered.

P2para.Text: Omit subsection (10).

P1para.Text: Omit section 809Z1 (public access rule: relevant VAT relief).

P2para.Text: Section 809Z4 (temporary importation rule) is amended as follows.
In subsection (1), after “days” insert “(subject to any increase under subsection (3B))”.
In subsection (3)—

P3para.Text: before paragraph (a) insert—
the property meets the public access rule,
after paragraph (b) insert—
subsection (3A) applies to the property,
in paragraph (d) for “or 809YC(2)” substitute “, 809YC(2) or 809YF(4)”.

P2para.Text: After that subsection insert—
This subsection applies to the property if—

P3para.Text: it is not available to be used or enjoyed in the United Kingdom by or for the benefit of a relevant person because it has been lost, stolen or destroyed,
(if lost or stolen) it has not been recovered, and
no compensation payment has been released in respect of it.

P2para.Text: If—

P3para.Text: property that has been lost or stolen is recovered,
the first day after the day on which it is recovered is a countable day, and
excluding that countable day there have already been 231 or more countable days in relation to the property,

P2para.Text: the number of countable days specified in subsection (1) is read as being increased by the number necessary for there to be 45 countable days beginning with the countable day mentioned in paragraph (b).
Omit subsections (4) to (10).

P1para.Text: In section 809Z6 (exempt property: other interpretation), after subsection (4) insert—

P2para.Text: References to property being lost, stolen or destroyed are to the property being lost, stolen or destroyed whilst in the United Kingdom.
“Compensation payment”, in relation to property that has been lost, stolen or destroyed, means any payment of compensation (whether under an insurance policy or otherwise) in respect of the property.
A compensation payment is “released” on the day on which it first becomes available for use in the United Kingdom by or for the benefit of any relevant person.
Property that has been lost or stolen is “recovered” on the day on which it becomes available to be used or enjoyed in the United Kingdom by or for the benefit of a relevant person.

P1para.Text: The amendments made by paragraphs 3, 4, 5(4), 7(2), (3)(b) and (c) and (4) and 8 have effect in relation to property that is lost, stolen or destroyed on or after 6 April 2013.
The other amendments made by this Schedule have effect—

P3para.Text: in relation to property that is not in the United Kingdom on 6 April 2013, as from that date, and
in relation to property that is in the United Kingdom on that date, as from the time when it ceases to be in the United Kingdom or is lost or stolen.

P1para.Text: In the case of property that falls within paragraph 10(b) by virtue of being lost or stolen, any period that is a period of importation in relation to the property for the purposes of section 809Z4 of ITA 2007 ends with the time at which it is lost or stolen.

TitleBlock.Title: Gains from contracts for life insurance etc

P1para.Text: Chapter 9 of Part 4 of ITTOIA 2005 (gains from contracts for life insurance etc) is amended as follows.
In section 476 (special rules: foreign policies) in subsection (2)—

P3para.Text: after the entry relating to section 474(3) to (5) insert “and”,
omit the entry relating to section 528,
omit the “and” after the entry relating to sections 531 to 534, and
omit the entry relating to section 536(6).

P1para.Text: For section 528 substitute—

P1group.Title: Reduction in amount charged on basis of non-UK residence where individual liable for tax

P2para.Text: Subsection (2) applies if—

P3para.Text: an individual is liable for tax charged on a gain from a policy of life insurance or a capital redemption policy, and
there are one or more days in the material interest period on which the individual is not UK resident.

P2para.Text: In determining the individual’s liability for tax, the gain on which the tax is charged in the case of the individual is to be reduced by the appropriate fraction.
The appropriate fraction is—

Para.Text: where—
A is the number of days in the material interest period which are days falling within subsection (1)(b), and
B is the number of days in the material interest period.

P2para.Text: In subsection (2) the reference to the gain is to be read in accordance with section 463A(4), 463D(4) or 463E(3) (which relates to restricted relief qualifying policies) if applicable.

In this section “the material interest period” means so much of the policy period as during which the individual meets condition A, B or C in section 465 in relation to the policy (subject to subsection (7)).
Subsections (7) and (8) apply if, before the chargeable event, there is an assignment falling within section 487(c) in relation to the policy where the individual is the assignee.
There is to be added to the material interest period any part of the policy period falling before the assignment—

P3para.Text: during which the assignor meets condition A, B or C in section 465 in relation to the policy, and
which is not included in the material interest period under subsection (5).

P2para.Text: In relation to any period added to the material interest period under subsection (7), in subsection (1)(b) the reference to the individual is to be read as a reference to the assignor.
For the purposes of subsections (5) and (7), in section 465(2) to (4) references to the rights under the policy are to be read as including references to a share of those rights.
In this section “the policy period” means the period for which the policy has run before the chargeable event occurs.
If the policy is a policy of life insurance which is a new policy in relation to another policy, for the purposes of subsection (10) the new policy is to be taken to have run—

P3para.Text: from the issue of the other policy, or
if it also was a new policy in relation to an earlier policy, from the issue of the earlier policy,

P2para.Text: and so on; and in subsections (5) to (9) references to the policy are to be read accordingly as including any relevant earlier policy.
In subsection (11) “new policy” has the meaning given in paragraph 17 of Schedule 15 to ICTA.

P1group.Title: Reduction in amount charged on basis of non-UK residence of deceased person

P2para.Text: Subsection (3) applies if—

P3para.Text: personal representatives are liable for tax charged on a gain from a policy of life insurance or a capital redemption policy under section 466, and
there were one or more days in the material interest period on which the deceased was not UK resident.

P2para.Text: Subsection (3) also applies if—

P3para.Text: trustees are liable for tax charged on a gain from a policy of life insurance or a capital redemption policy under section 467 where—

P4para.Text: of conditions A to D in that section, only condition B is met, and
the absent settlor condition which is met is the one in subsection (4)(b) of that section (deceased settlor),

P3para.Text: there were one or more days in the material interest period on which the deceased was not UK resident, and
the deceased was UK resident when the deceased died.

P2para.Text: In determining the liability for tax of the personal representatives or trustees, the gain on which the tax is charged in the case of the personal representatives or trustees is to be reduced by the appropriate fraction.
The appropriate fraction is—

Para.Text: where—
A is the number of days in the material interest period which are days falling within subsection (1)(b) or (2)(b) (as the case may be), and
B is the number of days in the material interest period.

P2para.Text: In subsection (3) the reference to the gain is to be read in accordance with section 463C(8) (which relates to restricted relief qualifying policies) if applicable.

In this section “the material interest period” means so much of the policy period falling before the deceased’s death as during which the deceased met condition A, B or C in section 465 in relation to the policy (subject to subsection (8)).
Subsections (8) and (9) apply if, before the deceased’s death, there was an assignment falling within section 487(c) in relation to the policy where the deceased was the assignee.
There is to be added to the material interest period any part of the policy period falling before the assignment—

P3para.Text: during which the assignor met condition A, B or C in section 465 in relation to the policy, and
which is not included in the material interest period under subsection (6).

P2para.Text: In relation to any period added to the material interest period under subsection (8), in subsection (1)(b) or (2)(b) the reference to the deceased is to be read as a reference to the assignor.
For the purposes of subsections (6) and (8), in section 465(2) to (4) references to the rights under the policy are to be read as including references to a share of those rights.
In this section “the policy period” means the period for which the policy has run before the chargeable event occurs.
If the policy is a policy of life insurance which is a new policy in relation to another policy, for the purposes of subsection (11) the new policy is to be taken to have run—

P3para.Text: from the issue of the other policy, or
if it also was a new policy in relation to an earlier policy, from the issue of the earlier policy,

P2para.Text: and so on; and in subsections (6) to (10) references to the policy are to be read accordingly as including any relevant earlier policy.
In subsection (12) “new policy” has the meaning given in paragraph 17 of Schedule 15 to ICTA.

P1para.Text: Omit section 529 (exceptions to section 528).

P2para.Text: Section 536 (top slicing relieved liability: one chargeable event) is amended as follows.
In subsection (6) for the words from “from” to the end substitute “reduced under section 528 in the case of the individual.”
For subsection (7) substitute—

If in the case of the individual the gain is reduced under section 528, for steps 1 and 3 in subsection (1) N is reduced by the number of complete years consisting wholly of days falling within section 528(1)(b) (including days falling within section 528(1)(b) by virtue of section 528(8)).

P1para.Text: In section 552 of ICTA (information: duty of insurers) after subsection (13) insert—

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this section no account is to be taken of the effect of sections 528 and 528A of ITTOIA 2005.
The amendments made by this Schedule have effect in relation to—

P3para.Text: any policy of life insurance issued in respect of an insurance made on or after 6 April 2013, or
any contract constituting a capital redemption policy made on or after that date.

P2para.Text: The amendment made by paragraph 3 above has effect in relation to any insurance or contract made before 6 April 2013 if on or after that date—

P3para.Text: the policy or contract is varied with the result that there is an increase in the benefits secured,
there is or was an assignment (or assignation) of rights, or a share of the rights, conferred by the policy or contract (whether or not for money’s worth) to the individual or deceased, or
some or all of the rights conferred by the policy or contract become or became held as a security for a debt of the individual or deceased,

P2para.Text: and the other amendments made by this Schedule have effect in relation to the insurance or contract accordingly.
For the purposes of sub-paragraph (2)(a) an exercise of rights conferred by a policy or contract is to count as a variation of the policy or contract.

In the case of a policy or contract treated under section 473A of ITTOIA 2005 as a single policy or contract, for the purposes of sub-paragraphs (1) and (2)the date on which the insurance or contract is made is the date on which, as the case may be—

P3para.Text: the first insurance is made in respect of which the connected policies are issued, or
the first of the connected contracts is made.

TitleBlock.Title: Qualifying insurance policies

Part.Title: Amendments of Schedule 15 to ICTA etc

P1para.Text: Schedule 15 to ICTA (qualifying insurance policies) is amended as follows.
Before Part 1 insert—

P1group.Title: Premium limit for qualifying policies to apply from 6 April 2013

P2para.Text: Sub-paragraph (2) applies if—

P3para.Text: an event falling within sub-paragraph (3) occurs,
apart from sub-paragraph (2), the policy to which the event relates would be a qualifying policy after the event, and
an individual who is a beneficiary under that policy is in breach of the premium limit for qualifying policies.

P2para.Text: That policy is not to be a qualifying policy after the event.
The events falling within this sub-paragraph are—

P3para.Text: the issue of a policy in respect of an insurance made on or after 6 April 2013;
the variation of a policy on or after 6 April 2013 where as a result of the variation—

P4para.Text: the period over which premiums are payable under the policy is or could be lengthened, or
the total amount of the premiums payable under the policy in any relevant period is or could be increased,

P3para.Text: or both;
the assignment on or after 6 April 2013 of any rights, or any share in any rights, under a policy where the assignment falls within paragraph B2(3)(c) to (g) below;
a deceased beneficiary event on or after 6 April 2013;
the conditions in paragraph 24(3) below being fulfilled for the first time in respect of a new non-resident policy where—

P4para.Text: the conditions are fulfilled for the first time on or after 6 April 2013, and
but for the conditions being fulfilled, the policy could not be a qualifying policy because of paragraph 24(2).

P2para.Text: An event does not fall within sub-paragraph (3) if—

P3para.Text: the policy to which the event relates is—

P4para.Text: a protected policy,
a restricted relief qualifying policy, or
a pure protection policy,

P3para.Text: the event is the issue of a policy which is a new policy in relation to an earlier policy where—

P4para.Text: the new policy is issued in substitution for the earlier policy (and not on its maturity), and

the life assured under the new policy is different to the life assured under the earlier policy but that is the only difference to what the position would have been had the earlier policy continued to run,

P3para.Text: paragraph 20ZA below applies to a policy and the event is the reinstatement or replacement of the policy as mentioned in paragraph 20ZA(4),
the event is the issue or variation of a policy in relation to which paragraph 29 of Schedule 39 to the Finance Act 2012 applies, or
the event is an assignment falling within paragraph B2(3)(e) below where the assignment is a mortgage endowment assignment.

P2para.Text: In sub-paragraph (3)(b)(ii) “relevant period” means any period of 12 months beginning at or after the time of the variation.
A variation is to be ignored for the purposes of sub-paragraph (3)(b) if its effect is nullified before the end of the period of 3 months after the day on which the variation occurs.
Sub-paragraph (4)(a)(i) does not apply in the case of an event mentioned in sub-paragraph (3)(e).
Sub-paragraph (4)(a)(ii) does not apply in the case of—

P3para.Text: an event mentioned in sub-paragraph (3)(c) or (d)occurring in relation to a restricted relief qualifying policy (“the assigned policy”),
any subsequent event relating to the assigned policy, or
any event relating to—

P4para.Text: a later policy which is a new policy in relation to the assigned policy, or
any policy which is a new policy in relation to the later policy,

P3para.Text: and so on.

P2para.Text: In the case of an event mentioned in sub-paragraph (3)(b), sub-paragraph (4)(a)(iii) applies only if the policy is a pure protection policy both before and after the variation.
This paragraph is to be applied after all other provisions of this Schedule relevant to the question of whether a policy is a qualifying policy after an event have been applied.
Sub-paragraph (2) applies if—

P3para.Text: an event falling within sub-paragraph (3) occurs,
the policy to which the event relates is a qualifying policy after the event, and
an individual who is a beneficiary under that policy is in breach of the premium limit for qualifying policies.

P2para.Text: That policy is to be a restricted relief qualifying policy after the event.
The events falling within this sub-paragraph are—

P3para.Text: a premium limit event in relation to a protected policy on or after 21 March 2012;

the issue of a policy as mentioned in paragraph A4(2)(b)below if, assuming that the substitution of the protected policy were instead a variation of that policy, there would be a premium limit event in relation to that policy;
the assignment on or after 6 April 2013 of any rights, or any share in any rights, under a protected policy where the assignment falls within paragraph B2(3)(c) to (g) below;
a deceased beneficiary event on or after 6 April 2013 where the policy in question is a protected policy;
the issue of a policy in respect of an insurance made on or after 21 March 2012 but before 6 April 2013 otherwise than as mentioned in paragraph A4(2)(b) below;
the variation of a policy, other than a protected policy, on or after 21 March 2012 but before 6 April 2013 where as a result of the variation—

P4para.Text: the period over which premiums are payable under the policy is or could be lengthened, or
the total amount of the premiums payable under the policy in any relevant period is or could be increased,

P3para.Text: or both;
the conditions in either sub-paragraph (3) or sub-paragraph (4) of paragraph 24 below being fulfilled for the first time in respect of a new non-resident policy where—

P4para.Text: the conditions are fulfilled for the first time on or after 21 March 2012 but before 6 April 2013, and
but for the conditions being fulfilled, the policy could not be a qualifying policy because of sub-paragraph (2) of paragraph 24.

P2para.Text: An event does not fall within sub-paragraph (3) if—

P3para.Text: the policy to which the event relates is a pure protection policy,
the event is the issue of a policy which is a new policy in relation to an earlier policy where—

P4para.Text: the new policy is issued in substitution for the earlier policy (and not on its maturity), and

the life assured under the new policy is different to the life assured under the earlier policy but that is the only difference to what the position would have been had the earlier policy continued to run,

P3para.Text: paragraph 20ZA below applies to a policy and the event is the reinstatement or replacement of the policy as mentioned in paragraph 20ZA(4),
the event is the issue or variation of a policy in relation to which paragraph 29 of Schedule 39 to the Finance Act 2012 applies, or
the event is an assignment falling within paragraph B2(3)(e) below where the assignment is a mortgage endowment assignment.

P2para.Text: In sub-paragraph (3)(f)(ii) “relevant period” means any period of 12 months beginning at or after the time of the variation.
A premium limit event or a variation is to be ignored for the purposes of sub-paragraph (3)(a) or (f) if its effect is nullified before 6 July 2013.

In the case of a premium limit event which occurs on or after 6 April 2013, in sub-paragraph (6) the reference to 6 July 2013 is to be read as a reference to the end of the period of 3 months after the day on which the premium limit event occurs.

In the case of an event mentioned in sub-paragraph (3)(a) or (f), sub-paragraph (4)(a) applies only if the policy is a pure protection policy both before and after the premium limit event or variation.
A “premium limit event” occurs in relation to a protected policy if—

P3para.Text: the policy is varied or a relevant option is exercised so as to change the terms of the policy, and
as a result of the variation or exercise of the relevant option—

P4para.Text: the period over which premiums are payable under the policy is or could be lengthened, or
the total amount of the premiums payable under the policy in any relevant period is or could be increased,

P3para.Text: or both.

P2para.Text: A “premium limit event” also occurs in relation to a protected policy if on or after 6 April 2013—

P3para.Text: the policy is varied or a relevant option is exercised so as to change the terms of the policy, and
as a result of the variation or exercise of the relevant option—

P4para.Text: the period over which premiums are payable under the policy is or could be shortened, or
the total amount of the premiums payable under the policy in any relevant period is or could be decreased,

P3para.Text: or both.

P2para.Text: In sub-paragraphs (9)(b)(ii) and (10)(b)(ii) “relevant period” means any period of 12 months beginning at or after the time of the variation or exercise of the relevant option.
The variation of, or exercise of a relevant option under, a protected policy is not a premium limit event in relation to the policy if—

P3para.Text: the policy secures a capital sum payable either—

P4para.Text: on survival for a specified term, or
on earlier death or on earlier death or disability,

P3para.Text: the policy is issued and maintained for the sole purpose of ensuring that the borrower under an interest-only mortgage will have sufficient funds to repay the principal lent under the mortgage, and
the policy is varied, or the relevant option is exercised, for that sole purpose.

P2para.Text: In sub-paragraph (3)(g) references to paragraph 24 below are to that paragraph as it has effect before the appointed date for the purposes of section 55 of the Finance Act 1995.
A qualifying policy which is a new policy in relation to an earlier policy is a restricted relief qualifying policy if the earlier policy is a restricted relief qualifying policy.
A policy which is a restricted relief qualifying policy remains a restricted relief qualifying policy so long as it is a qualifying policy.
Paragraph A1 above is to be ignored in determining for the purposes of sub-paragraph (14) or (15) if a policy is a qualifying policy.
For further provision about restricted relief qualifying policies, see sections 463A to 463D of ITTOIA 2005.

P1group.Title: The premium limit for qualifying policies

P2para.Text: For the purposes of paragraphs A1(1)(c) and A2(1)(c) above an individual is in breach of the premium limit for qualifying policies if the total amount of the premiums payable under relevant policies in any relevant period—

P3para.Text: exceeds £3,600, or
could exceed £3,600 as a result of—

P4para.Text: the exercise of any one or more relevant options conferred by one or more relevant policies, or
so far as not covered by sub-paragraph (i), the application of one or more terms of one or more relevant policies relating to increases in premiums.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of sub-paragraph (1)—

P3para.Text: so much of a premium payable under a relevant policy as is charged on the grounds that an exceptional risk of death or disability is involved is to be left out of account in determining the premiums payable under the policy,
so much of the first premium payable under a relevant policy the liability for the payment of which—

P4para.Text: is discharged in accordance with paragraph 15(2) below, or
in the case of a policy in relation to which paragraph 3 below applies, is discharged under a provision of the policy falling within paragraph 3(4)(c),

P3para.Text: is to be left out of account in determining the premiums payable under the policy (subject to sub-paragraph (3)below),
in determining the premiums payable under a relevant policy any provision for the waiver of premiums by reason of a person’s disability is to be ignored, and
“relevant period” means any period of 12 months beginning at or after the time when the event falling within paragraph A1(3) or A2(3) above (“the relevant event”) occurs.

P2para.Text: The maximum amount that may be left out of account under sub-paragraph (2)(b) in the case of a relevant policy is—

Para.Text: where N is the number of complete years for which ran—

P3para.Text: the other policy involved, or
if there is more than one other policy involved, the policy which ran for the most number of complete years.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this paragraph the following are “relevant policies”—

P3para.Text: the policy to which the relevant event relates, and
any other policy—

P4para.Text: which is a qualifying policy, and
under which the individual is a beneficiary.

P2para.Text: But neither a protected policy nor a pure protection policy is to be a relevant policy by virtue of sub-paragraph (4)(b).

Sub-paragraph (7) applies if this paragraph is to be applied in the case of an individual in consequence of two or more events occurring at the same time (including where one or more of the events falls within paragraph A1(3) above and one or more of the events falls within paragraph A2(3) above).

For the purpose of applying this paragraph in the case of the individual in consequence of any of the events, sub-paragraph (4)(a) has effect as if the reference to the policy to which the relevant event relates were a reference to all the policies to which the events, taken together, relate.
But sub-paragraph (7) does not apply, and sub-paragraph (9)applies instead, if—

P3para.Text: all the policies in question are policies issued by the same issuer, and
each of them has an unique identifier in a series of unique identifiers which the issuer gives to policies issued by it.

P2para.Text: For the purpose of applying this paragraph in the case of the individual in consequence of any of the events, an event relating to a policy (“policy A”) is treated as occurring before an event relating to another policy (“policy B”) if, in the issuer’s series of unique identifiers, policy A’s unique identifier comes before policy B’s unique identifier.
This paragraph applies for the purposes of this Part of this Schedule.
A policy is “protected” if—

P3para.Text: it is issued in respect of an insurance made before 21 March 2012, or
it is issued in respect of an insurance made on or after 21 March 2012 where—

P4para.Text: it is a new policy in relation to an earlier policy,
it is issued in substitution for the earlier policy (and not on its maturity), and
the earlier policy is a protected policy (whether by virtue of paragraph (a) or this paragraph).

P2para.Text: A policy which is protected ceases to be protected if it becomes a restricted relief qualifying policy.
A policy issued as mentioned in sub-paragraph (2)(b) is not protected if—

P3para.Text: its issue is an event falling within paragraph A2(3) above, and
after that event it is a restricted relief qualifying policy.

P1group.Title: How to determine if an individual is a beneficiary under a policy

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies for the purposes of this Part of this Schedule in determining if an individual is a beneficiary under a policy.
An individual is a beneficiary under a policy if the individual beneficially owns—

P3para.Text: any rights under the policy, or
any share in any rights under the policy.

P2para.Text: An individual is a beneficiary under a policy if—

P3para.Text: any rights under the policy are, or any share in any rights under the policy is, held on non-charitable trusts created by the individual, and
those rights are, or that share is, not beneficially owned by any individual.

P2para.Text: The following provisions of ITTOIA 2005 apply for the purposes of sub-paragraph (3)(a)—

P3para.Text: section 465(6), and
the definition of “non-charitable trust” in section 545(1).

P2para.Text: An individual is a beneficiary under a policy if—

P3para.Text: any rights under the policy are, or any share in any rights under the policy is, held as security for a debt of the individual, and
those rights are, or that share is, not beneficially owned by any individual.

P2para.Text: In this Part of this Schedule—

P3para.Text: “new policy” has the meaning given in paragraph 17 below,
references to the variation of a policy are to a variation in relation to which paragraph 18 below applies,
“pure protection policy” means a policy—

P4para.Text: which has no surrender value and is not capable of acquiring a surrender value, or
under which the benefits payable cannot exceed the amount of the premiums paid except on death or in respect of disability, and

P3para.Text: “relevant option”, in relation to a policy, means an option conferred by the policy on the person to whom it is issued to have another policy substituted for it or to have any of its terms changed.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this Part of this Schedule a “deceased beneficiary event” occurs if, in connection with the death of an individual (“D”) who was a beneficiary under a policy, an individual (“B”) becomes a beneficiary under that policy by reference (wholly or partly) to any rights, or to any share in any
rights, by reference to which D was a beneficiary (wholly or partly).
For the purposes of this Part of this Schedule an assignment is a “mortgage endowment assignment” if—

P3para.Text: the policy to which the assignment relates secures a capital sum payable either—

P4para.Text: on survival for a specified term, or
on earlier death or on earlier death or disability,

P3para.Text: the policy is issued and maintained for the sole purpose of ensuring that the borrower under an interest-only mortgage will have sufficient funds to repay the principal lent under the mortgage, and
when the assignment occurs, it is intended that the policy will continue to be maintained for that sole purpose.

P1para.Text: At the beginning of Part 1 (qualifying conditions) insert—

P1group.Title: Rights to be beneficially owned by individuals only

P2para.Text: Sub-paragraph (2) applies in relation to a policy issued in respect of an insurance made on or after 6 April 2013.
In order for the policy to be a qualifying policy, when it is issued all the rights under it must be beneficially owned by (and only by)—

P3para.Text: one individual, or
two or more individuals taken together.

P2para.Text: (This is the case notwithstanding any other provision of this Schedule.)
Sub-paragraph (2) does not apply if the policy is protected.
A policy is “protected” if it is a new policy (as defined in paragraph 17 below) in relation to—

P3para.Text: a policy issued in respect of an insurance made before 21 March 2012, or
a policy which is protected (whether by virtue of paragraph (a) or this paragraph).

P2para.Text: Sub-paragraph (2) applies if any rights under a qualifying policy are, or any share in any rights under a qualifying policy is, assigned on or after 6 April 2013.
The policy is not to be a qualifying policy after the assignment (notwithstanding any other provision of this Schedule).
Sub-paragraph (2) does not apply if—

P3para.Text: the assignment is from an individual by way of security for a debt of the individual,
the assignment is to an individual on the discharge of a debt of the individual secured by the rights or share,
the assignment is from an individual to the individual’s spouse or civil partner,
the assignment is to an individual in pursuance of an order made by a court,
the assignment is to an individual in pursuance of a legally enforceable obligation relating to a divorce or the dissolution of a civil partnership,
the assignment is from an individual and, as a result of the assignment, the rights assigned are, or the share assigned is, held on trusts created by the individual,
the assignment is to an individual and, as a result of the assignment, the rights assigned are, or the share assigned is, no longer held on trusts, or
the assignment—

P4para.Text: is to the personal representatives of a deceased individual, or
is to an individual where, as a result of the assignment, a deceased beneficiary event (see paragraph A6(2) above) occurs.

P2para.Text: Section 465(6) of ITTOIA 2005 applies for the purposes of sub-paragraph (3)(f).
See paragraphs A1 and A2 above which may apply in consequence of an assignment falling within sub-paragraph (3).
Sub-paragraph (2) applies if any of the following events occurs—

P3para.Text: the issue of a policy in respect of an insurance made on or after 6 April 2013;
the variation of a policy on or after 6 April 2013 where paragraph 18 below applies in relation to the variation and as a result of the variation—

P4para.Text: the period over which premiums are payable under the policy is or could be lengthened, or
the total amount of the premiums payable under the policy in any relevant period is or could be increased,

P3para.Text: or both;
a premium limit event in relation to a protected policy on or after 6 April 2013 (see paragraph A2(9) to (12) above);
an event on or after 6 April 2013 which would be a premium limit event in relation to a protected policy but for paragraph A2(12) above;
the assignment on or after 6 April 2013 of any rights, or any share in any rights, under a policy where the assignment falls within paragraph B2(3)(c) to (g) above;
a deceased beneficiary event (see paragraph A6(2) above) on or after 6 April 2013;
the conditions in paragraph 24(3) below being fulfilled for the first time in respect of a new non-resident policy where—

P4para.Text: the conditions are fulfilled for the first time on or after 6 April 2013, and
but for the conditions being fulfilled, the policy could not be a qualifying policy because of paragraph 24(2).

P2para.Text: Each individual who is a beneficiary under the policy must, before the end of the statement period, make to the issuer of the policy a statement dealing with the prescribed matters.
If an individual does not comply with sub-paragraph (2) the policy is not to be a qualifying policy after the event (notwithstanding any other provision of this Schedule).
In sub-paragraph (1)(b)(ii) “relevant period” means any period of 12 months beginning at or after the time of the variation.
Sub-paragraph (2)—

P3para.Text: does not apply in the case of an event mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)(a), (e), (f) or (g) if the policy is a pure protection policy, and
does not apply in the case of an event mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)(b), (c) or (d) if the policy is a pure protection policy both before and after the event.

P2para.Text: “Pure protection policy” has the meaning given by paragraph A6(1)(c) above.
Sub-paragraph (2) does not apply in the case of an event mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)(e) where the assignment falls within paragraph B2(3)(e) above and is a mortgage endowment assignment.
In sub-paragraph (2)—

P3para.Text: the reference to an individual who is a beneficiary under the policy is to be read in accordance with paragraph A5above,
“the statement period” means—

P4para.Text: the period of 3 months after the day on which the event occurs, or
if the event occurs before the day on which the Finance Act 2013 is passed, the period of 3 months after that day,

P3para.Text: or such longer period as an officer of Revenue and Customs may allow, and
“prescribed” means prescribed by regulations made by the Commissioners for Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs.

P2para.Text: An officer of Revenue and Customs may allow a longer period for the purposes of sub-paragraph (7)(b) only if—

P3para.Text: the individual in question has made a request in writing to an officer of Revenue and Customs for a longer period to be allowed, and
such an officer is satisfied—

P4para.Text: that there is a reasonable excuse for the required statement not having been made within the period mentioned in sub-paragraph (7)(b)(i) or (ii), and
that the request under paragraph (a) was made without unreasonable delay after the reasonable excuse ceased.

P2para.Text: Regulations under sub-paragraph (7)(c) may—

P3para.Text: make different provision for different cases or circumstances, and
contain incidental, supplementary, consequential, transitional, transitory or saving provision.

P2para.Text: Paragraph 17 (substitutions) is amended as follows.
In sub-paragraph (2) before paragraph (a) insert—

P3para.Text: the new policy cannot be a qualifying policy if the old policy was not a qualifying policy by virtue of—

P4para.Text: paragraph A1(2), B1(2), B2(2) or B3(3) above, or
sub-paragraph (i) above or this sub-paragraph;

P2para.Text: In sub-paragraph (2)(a) after the first “not” insert “and paragraph (za) above does not apply”.
In sub-paragraph (4) for “(2)” substitute “(2)(a) to (c)”.
After sub-paragraph (4) insert—

In determining under sub-paragraph (2)(a) to (c) above whether the new policy would apart from this paragraph be a qualifying policy, paragraph A1 above is not to be applied in relation to the issue of the new policy; but this does not stop that paragraph being applied in relation to the issue of the new policy after this paragraph has been applied.

P1para.Text: In paragraph 25 (application of paragraph 17 in cases involving new non-resident policies) after sub-paragraph (2) insert—

P2para.Text: In determining for the purposes of sub-paragraph (2)(a) above whether a policy would, apart from paragraph 24, have been a qualifying policy, paragraphs A1 and B1 to B3 above are to be ignored.

In section 55 of FA 1995 (qualifying life insurance policies: disapplication of paragraph 21 of Schedule 15 to ICTA from appointed date) in subsection (3) after “subject” insert “to paragraphs A1(2), B2(2) and B3(3) of that Schedule and”.
The amendment made by this paragraph is treated as having come into force on the appointed date (see section 55(9) of FA 1995).

P1para.Text: Chapter 9 of Part 4 of ITTOIA 2005 (gains from contracts for life insurance etc) is amended as follows.
After section 463 insert—

P1group.Title: Restricted relief qualifying policies: disapplication of section 485 etc

P2para.Text: This section applies for the purpose of determining if an individual is liable for tax charged under this Chapter.

In relation to an event occurring on or after 6 April 2013, section 485 (disregard of certain events in relation to qualifying policies) does not apply in relation to a policy (“policy X”) which is a restricted relief qualifying policy (see paragraph A2 of Schedule 15 to ICTA).
If an individual is liable for tax charged under this Chapter as a result of subsection (2), the gain on which the tax is charged in the case of the individual is reduced by the following amount—

Para.Text: where—
G is the amount of the gain (apart from this subsection),
TAP is the total amount of premiums payable under policy X during the policy X period so far as they are allowable premiums as determined in accordance with section 463B, and
TP is the total amount of premiums payable under policy X during the policy X period.

P2para.Text: If section 528 also applies in the case of the individual in relation to the gain, subsection (3) is to be applied to the gain before section 528 and, accordingly, the reduction to be made under section 528 is to be determined by reference to the gain as reduced by subsection (3).
The following subsections apply for the purposes of this section (except subsection (2)) and section 463B.
“The policy X period” means the period for which policy X has run before the chargeable event occurs.
Subsections (8) and (9) apply if policy X is a new policy in relation to another policy.
For the purposes of subsection (6) policy X is to be taken to have run—

P3para.Text: from the issue of the other policy, or
if the other policy was also a new policy in relation to an earlier policy, from the issue of the earlier policy,

P2para.Text: and so on.
References to premiums payable under policy X are to be read as including references to premiums payable under any earlier policy taken into account under subsection (8).
The following are to be left out of account in determining the premiums payable under a policy—

P3para.Text: so much of a premium as is charged on the grounds that an exceptional risk of death or disability is involved;
subject to subsection (11), so much of the first premium payable the liability for the payment of which—

P4para.Text: is discharged in accordance with paragraph 15(2) of Schedule 15 to ICTA, or
in the case of a policy in relation to which paragraph 3 of that Schedule applies, is discharged under a provision of the policy falling within paragraph 3(4)(c) of that Schedule.

P2para.Text: The maximum amount that may be left out of account under subsection (10)(b) in the case of a policy is—

Para.Text: where N is the number of complete years for which ran—

P3para.Text: the other policy involved, or
if there is more than one other policy involved, the policy which ran for the most number of complete years.

P2para.Text: In determining the premiums payable under a policy any provision for the waiver of premiums by reason of a person’s disability is to be ignored.
“New policy” has the meaning given in paragraph 17 of Schedule 15 to ICTA.

P1group.Title: Restricted relief qualifying policies: allowable premiums

P2para.Text: This section sets out how to determine the extent to which premiums payable under policy X during the policy X period are allowable premiums for the purposes of section 463A(3).
A premium payable under policy X is allowable if it is payable before the restricted relief date.
In this section “the restricted relief date” means—

P3para.Text: 6 April 2013, or
if later, the date on which policy X became a restricted relief qualifying policy.

P2para.Text: Premiums payable under policy X in a relevant premium period are allowable so far as they do not exceed in total the premium limit for the period.
In subsection (4) “relevant premium period” means—

P3para.Text: any period of one year which—

P4para.Text: begins with a relevant date, and
ends in the policy X period, and

P3para.Text: if it is not covered by paragraph (a), the period which—

P4para.Text: begins with the last relevant date to fall within the policy X period, and
ends at the end of the policy X period.

P2para.Text: In subsection (5) “relevant date” means—

P3para.Text: the restricted relief date, or
any anniversary of the restricted relief date.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of subsection (4) “the premium limit” for a relevant premium period is determined in accordance with subsections (8) to (10).
Determine the premiums payable in the relevant premium period under policies related to policy X.
If the total of those premiums is £3,600 or more, the premium limit is nil (and, accordingly, no premiums payable under policy X in the relevant premium period are allowable).
If the total of those premiums is less than £3,600, the premium limit is the difference between that total and £3,600.
Subsection (4) does not apply if, at the time policy X became a restricted relief qualifying policy, any policy related to policy X was itself a restricted relief qualifying policy.
For the purposes of this section a policy is “related” to policy X if it met the following requirements at the time policy X became a restricted relief qualifying policy—

P3para.Text: the policy is a qualifying policy under which the individual is a beneficiary (as determined in accordance with paragraph A5 of Schedule 15 to ICTA);
the policy is neither a protected policy nor a pure protection policy.

P2para.Text: In subsection (12)(b)—

Para.Text: “protected policy” is to be read in accordance with paragraph A4 of Schedule 15 to ICTA, and
“pure protection policy” has the meaning given by paragraph A6(1)(c) of that Schedule.

P2para.Text: A policy which is a new policy in relation to a policy “related” to policy X (whether by virtue of subsection (12) or this subsection) is also “related” to policy X if it meets the requirements of subsection (12)(a) and (b) when issued.
A policy ceases to be “related” to policy X if it ceases to meet those requirements.

If policy X is a restricted relief qualifying policy as provided for by paragraph A2(14) of Schedule 15 to ICTA, references in this section to policy X becoming a restricted relief qualifying policy are to be read as references to the policy determined under subsection (17)becoming a restricted relief qualifying policy.
The policy is—

P3para.Text: the policy (“policy Y”) in relation to which policy X was the new policy, or
if policy Y was also a restricted relief qualifying policy as provided for by paragraph A2(14) of Schedule 15 to ICTA, the policy in relation to which policy Y was the new policy,

P2para.Text: and so on.
The following subsections apply for the purposes of this section if—

P3para.Text: a premium (“premium A”) is payable under policy X on a day (“day A”) which is on or after 21 March 2012 but before 6 April 2013, and
the next premium payable under policy X is payable on a day (“day B”) which is—

P4para.Text: on or after 6 April 2013, and
more than one month after day A.

P2para.Text: Premium A is to be treated as if, instead of being one premium payable on day A, it were a series of premiums payable at monthly intervals with the first premium in the series payable on day A.
The number of premiums in the series is equal to the number of complete months falling within the period beginning with day A and ending with day B.
The amount of each premium in the series is the amount of premium A divided by the number of premiums in the series.

P1group.Title: Restricted relief qualifying policies: personal representatives and trustees with deceased settlors

P2para.Text: This section applies for the purpose of determining if personal representatives are liable for tax charged under this Chapter as provided for by section 466.
This section also applies for the purpose of determining if trustees are liable for tax charged under this Chapter as provided for by section 467 where—

P3para.Text: condition B in that section is met, and
the person who created the trusts has died.

P2para.Text: In relation to an event occurring on or after 6 April 2013, section 485 (disregard of certain events in relation to qualifying policies) does not apply in relation to a policy if the policy is a restricted relief qualifying policy (see paragraph A2 of Schedule 15 to ICTA).

If any personal representatives or trustees are liable for tax charged under this Chapter as a result of subsection (3), section 463A(3) is to apply in the case of the personal representatives or the trustees—

P3para.Text: as if the reference to the individual were to the personal representatives or to the trustees, and
as if the restricted relief qualifying policy were policy X.

P2para.Text: For this purpose—

P3para.Text: in section 463B(12)(a) the reference to the individual is to be read as a reference to the deceased, and
a policy—

P4para.Text: which would otherwise have ceased to be “related” to policy X for the purposes of section 463B on the deceased’s death, but
which continues to run after the deceased’s death,

P3para.Text: is to be treated as “related” to policy X after the deceased’s death.

P2para.Text: A policy which is a new policy (as defined in paragraph 17 of Schedule 15 to ICTA) in relation to a policy treated as “related” to policy X under subsection (5)(b) or this subsection is also to be treated as “related” to policy X if, apart from the deceased’s death, it would meet the requirements of section 463B(12)(a) and (b) on its issue.

A policy treated as “related” to policy X under subsection (5)(b) or (6)ceases to be so treated if, apart from the deceased’s death, it would cease to meet the requirements of section 463B(12)(a) and (b).

If section 528A also applies in the case of the personal representatives or the trustees in relation to the gain, section 463A(3) is to be applied to the gain before section 528A and, accordingly, the reduction to be made under section 528A is to be determined by reference to the gain as reduced by section 463A(3).

P1group.Title: Restricted relief qualifying policies: assignments and events following assignments etc

P2para.Text: This section applies if—

P3para.Text: paragraph A1 of Schedule 15 to ICTA applies in relation to a policy by virtue of paragraph A1(8) in consequence of an event relating to the policy (“the relevant event”),
after the relevant event, the policy is not a qualifying policy by virtue of paragraph A1(2), and
in relation to an event occurring after the relevant event—

P4para.Text: an individual is liable for tax charged under this Chapter on a gain from the policy, and
but for the application of paragraph A1 in relation to the policy, section 463A(3) would have applied in the case of the individual so as to reduce the gain.

P2para.Text: Section 463A(3) is to apply in the case of the individual in relation to the gain as if the policy were policy X.
But, for this purpose, section 463B(5) has effect as if the references to the policy X period were to the part of that period falling before the relevant event.

If section 528 also applies in the case of the individual in relation to the gain, section 463A(3) is to be applied to the gain before section 528 and, accordingly, the reduction to be made under section 528 is to be determined by reference to the gain as reduced by section 463A(3).

P1group.Title: Transitional protection for policies issued in respect of insurances made on or after 21 March 2012 but before 6 April 2013

P2para.Text: This section applies if—

P3para.Text: a policy (“policy Z”) is issued,
the issue of policy Z is an event falling within paragraph A2(3) of Schedule 15 to ICTA by virtue of paragraph (e),
after its issue, policy Z is a qualifying policy but not a restricted relief qualifying policy,
policy Z is varied on or after 6 April 2013 and the variation is an event falling within paragraph A1(3) of Schedule 15,
after the variation, policy Z is not a qualifying policy by virtue of paragraph A1(2) of that Schedule,
in relation to an event occurring after the variation, an individual is liable for tax charged under this Chapter on a gain from policy Z, and
but for the application of paragraph A1 of Schedule 15 in relation to policy Z, the individual would not have been liable because of section 485.

P2para.Text: The gain on which the tax is charged in the case of the individual is reduced by the following amount—

Para.Text: where—
G is the amount of the gain (apart from this subsection),
TPV is the total amount of premiums payable under policy Z before the variation, and
TP is the total amount of premiums payable under policy Z before the chargeable event.

P2para.Text: If section 528 also applies in the case of the individual in relation to the gain, subsection (2) is to be applied to the gain before section 528 and, accordingly, the reduction to be made under section 528 is to be determined by reference to the gain as reduced by subsection (2).
Section 463A(10) to (12) applies for the purposes of subsection (2).

P1para.Text: In section 485 (disregard of certain events in relation to qualifying policies) after subsection (7) insert—

P2para.Text: This section is subject to sections 463A and 463C.

P1para.Text: After section 552ZA of ICTA insert—

P1group.Title: Regulations in relation to qualifying policies

P2para.Text: The Commissioners for Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs may make regulations requiring relevant persons—

P3para.Text: to require the provision to them of prescribed information in connection with applications for the issue of qualifying policies;
to provide prescribed information to persons who apply for the issue of qualifying policies;
to provide to an officer of Revenue and Customs prescribed information about qualifying policies issued by them.

P2para.Text: The regulations may make such provision as the Commissioners think fit for securing that an officer of Revenue and Customs is able—

P3para.Text: to ascertain whether there has been or is likely to be any contravention of the requirements of the regulations, and
to verify any information provided to an officer of Revenue and Customs as required by the regulations.

P2para.Text: The provision that may be made by virtue of subsection (2) includes, in particular, provision requiring relevant persons to make available books, documents and other records for inspection by or on behalf of an officer of Revenue and Customs.
The regulations may—

P3para.Text: make different provision for different cases or circumstances, and
contain incidental, supplementary, consequential, transitional, transitory or saving provision.

P2para.Text: In this section—

Para.Text: “information” includes certificates issued by prescribed persons certifying prescribed matters,
“prescribed” means prescribed by the regulations,
“qualifying policy” includes a policy which would be a qualifying policy apart from—
paragraph A1(2), B1(2), B2(2) or B3(3) of Schedule 15, or
paragraph 17(2)(za) of that Schedule (including as applied by paragraph 18), and
“relevant person”, in relation to a qualifying policy, means the the person who issues, or is proposing to issue, the policy.

P1para.Text: In section 552B of ICTA (duties of overseas insurers’ tax representatives) in subsection (2)—

P3para.Text: after paragraph (b) omit “and”, and
after paragraph (c) insert
any duties imposed by regulations under section 552ZB,

P1para.Text: In section 98 of TMA 1970 (special returns etc), in the second column of the Table, after the entry for regulations under section 552ZA(6) of ICTA insert—

P3para.Text: regulations under section 552ZB;

TitleBlock.Title: Transfer of assets abroad

P1para.Text: Chapter 2 of Part 13 of ITA 2007 (tax avoidance: transfer of assets abroad) is amended as follows.

Part.Title: New exemption for genuine transactions etc

P1para.Text: In section 718 (meaning of “person abroad” etc) in subsection (2) omit paragraph (a) (UK resident body corporate incorporated outside UK treated as resident outside UK).
In section 720 (charge to tax on income treated as arising under section 721) in subsection (7)—

P3para.Text: for “742” substitute “742A”, and
after “transaction” insert “, etc”.

P1para.Text: In section 727 (charge to tax on income treated as arising under section 728) in subsection (5)—

P3para.Text: for “742” substitute “742A”, and
after “transaction” insert “, etc”.

P1para.Text: In section 731 (charge to tax on income treated as arising under section 732) in subsection (4)—

P3para.Text: for “742” substitute “742A”, and
after “transaction” insert “, etc”.

P2para.Text: Section 736 (exemptions: introduction) is amended as follows.
In subsection (1) for “742” substitute “742A”.
After subsection (2) insert—
The exemption given by section 742A applies only in the case of a relevant transaction effected on or after 6 April 2012.

P1para.Text: After section 742 insert—

P1group.Title: Post-5 April 2012 transactions: exemption for genuine transactions

P2para.Text: Subsection (2) applies for the purpose of determining the liability of an individual to tax under this Chapter by reference to a relevant transaction if—

P3para.Text: the transaction is effected on or after 6 April 2012, and
conditions A and B are met.

P2para.Text: Income is to be left out of account so far as the individual satisfies an officer of Revenue and Customs that it is attributable to the transaction.
Condition A is that—

P3para.Text: were, viewed objectively, the transaction to be considered to be a genuine transaction having regard to any arrangements under which it is effected and any other relevant circumstances, and
were the individual to be liable to tax under this Chapter by reference to the transaction,

P2para.Text: the individual’s liability to tax would, in contravention of a relevant treaty provision, constitute an unjustified and disproportionate restriction on a freedom protected under that relevant treaty provision.
In subsection (3) “relevant treaty provision” means—

P3para.Text: Title II or IV of Part Three of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union,
Part II or III of the EEA agreement, or
the provision of any subsequent treaty replacing a provision mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b).

P2para.Text: Condition B is that the individual satisfies an officer of Revenue and Customs that, viewed objectively, the transaction must be considered to be a genuine transaction having regard to any arrangements under which it is effected and any other relevant circumstances.
Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (3)(a) or (5), in order for the transaction to be considered to be a genuine transaction the transaction must not—

P3para.Text: be on terms other than those that would have been made between persons not connected with each other dealing at arm’s length, or
be a transaction that would not have been entered into between such persons so dealing,

P2para.Text: having regard to any arrangements under which the transaction is effected and any other relevant circumstances.

Subsection (8) applies if any asset or income falling within subsection (12) is used for the purposes of, or is received in the course of, activities carried on in a territory outside the United Kingdom by a person (“the relevant person”) through a business establishment which the relevant person has in that territory.

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (3)(a) or (5), in order for the transaction to be considered to be a genuine transaction the activities mentioned in subsection (7) must consist of the provision by the relevant person of goods or services to others on a commercial basis and involve—

P3para.Text: the use of staff in numbers, and with competence and authority,
the use of premises and equipment, and
the addition of economic value, by the relevant person, to those to whom the goods or services are provided,

P2para.Text: commensurate with the size and nature of those activities.
In subsection (8)(a) “staff” means employees, agents or contractors of the relevant person.
To determine if a person has a “business establishment” in a territory outside the United Kingdom, apply sections 1141, 1142(1) and 1143 of CTA 2010 as if in those provisions—

P3para.Text: references to a company were to a person, and
references to a permanent establishment were to a business establishment.

P2para.Text: Subsection (6) does not apply if—

P3para.Text: the relevant transfer is made by an individual who makes it wholly—

P4para.Text: for personal reasons (and not commercial reasons), and
for the personal benefit (and not the commercial benefit) of other individuals, and

P3para.Text: no consideration is given (directly or indirectly) for the relevant transfer or otherwise for any benefit received by any individual mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii),

P2para.Text: and all assets and income falling within subsection (12) are dealt with accordingly.
The assets and income falling within this subsection are—

P3para.Text: any of the assets transferred by the relevant transfer;
any assets directly or indirectly representing any of the assets transferred;
any income arising from any assets within paragraph (a) or (b);
any assets directly or indirectly representing the accumulations of income arising from any assets within paragraph (a) or (b).

P2para.Text: In subsections (11) and (12) references to the relevant transfer are to—

P3para.Text: if the transaction mentioned in subsection (1) is a relevant transfer, the transfer, or
if the transaction so mentioned is an associated operation, the relevant transfer to which it relates.

P2para.Text: Subsection (15) applies if—

P3para.Text: subsection (2) would apply in relation to a transaction but for the individual being unable to satisfy an officer of Revenue and Customs for the purposes of condition B that the transaction meets the requirements set out in subsection (6), but
the individual does satisfy an officer of Revenue and Customs that those requirements are met in relation to a part of the transaction.

P2para.Text: Subsection (2) applies as if the reference to the transaction were to that part of the transaction.

P1para.Text: In section 751 (the Tribunal’s jurisdiction on appeals) after paragraph (d) insert—

P3para.Text: section 742A (post-5 April 2012 transactions: exemption for genuine transactions),

P2para.Text: The amendment made by paragraph 2 above has effect in relation to times on or after 6 April 2012.
The amendments made by paragraphs 3 to 8 above have effect for the tax year 2012-13 and subsequent tax years.

TitleBlock.Title: Deduction of income tax at source etc

P1group.Title: Deduction from interest payable on compensation
