In relation to a relevant land transaction, the general rule is that references in this Part of this Act to the vendor are to be read as references to the vendor under the original contract (but see sub-paragraphs (4) and (5)).

In cases where the original contract was substantially performed before the transferee became entitled to call for a conveyance of the whole or part of the subject-matter of the original contract, references in this Part of this Act to the vendor are to be read as references to the person who was the purchaser under the original contract when it was substantially performed.
In relation to a relevant land transaction, references to the vendor in the specified provisions (see sub-paragraph (6)) are to be read as including—

P3para.Text: the vendor under the original contract, and
the transferor under any relevant assignment of rights.

P2para.Text: The specified provisions are—

P3para.Text: section 61(1)(a) (compliance with planning obligations: conditions for exemption);
section 66(1) and (2) (transfers involving public bodies);
paragraph 8(1)(a) of Schedule 4 (debt as consideration);
paragraph 10(2)(c) of Schedule 4 (carrying out of works);
paragraph 16 of Schedule 4 (indemnity given by vendor).

P2para.Text: The following are “relevant land transactions”—

P3para.Text: the land transaction effected by the conveyance mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)(b) or treated as effected by the substantial performance mentioned in that provision;
the notional land transaction mentioned in paragraph 5(1)(b) and any additional land transaction under paragraph 5(2).

P2para.Text: In determining under section 108(1) whether or not a relevant land transaction such as is mentioned in sub-paragraph (7)(a) is linked to another transaction, it may be assumed that any of the following is the vendor under the relevant land transaction—

P3para.Text: the vendor (determined in accordance with sub-paragraph (3)), or
the transferor under any relevant assignment of rights.

P2para.Text: The following are “relevant assignments of rights” in relation to a relevant land transaction—

P3para.Text: the assignment of rights mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)(a);
any other transaction that is an assignment of rights in relation to the original contract and has some subject-matter in common with the assignment of rights mentioned in paragraph (a).

P1group.Title: Free-standing transfers: consideration and substantial performance

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where the pre-completion transaction is a free-standing transfer.

If the transferee acquires the subject-matter of the free-standing transfer, the consideration for the transaction effecting that acquisition is taken to include the consideration given for the free-standing transfer (if that would not otherwise be the case).

References in sub-paragraph (2) to an acquisition include an acquisition deemed to take place under section 44(4) (and the reference to the transaction effecting that acquisition is read accordingly).

An action taken by the transferee (or an assignee of the transferee) that would, if taken by the original purchaser, constitute (for the purposes of section 44(5)) the taking of possession of the whole or substantially the whole of the subject-matter of the original contract is treated as effecting the substantial performance of the original contract.

If a transaction that is a free-standing transfer in relation a contract is also a free-standing transfer in relation to another contract (in particular, where there have been successive free-standing transfers), each of those contracts may be regarded as “the original contract” for the purposes of separate applications of sub-paragraph (4).
In sub-paragraph (4)—

P3para.Text: the reference to the transferee includes a person connected with the transferee, and
the reference to an assignee of the transferee includes a person connected with such a person.

P2para.Text: References in this paragraph to an assignee of the transferee are to a person who, as a result of a transaction that is an assignment of rights in relation to the free-standing transfer, is entitled to call for a conveyance of the whole or part of the subject-matter of the free-standing transfer.

P1group.Title: Meaning of “the vendor”: cases involving free-standing transfers

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where—

P3para.Text: a land transaction is effected, or treated as effected, by an acquisition falling within paragraph 9(2) (read with paragraph 9(3)), or
paragraph 8(1) (meaning of “vendor” where the transferee is the assignee under an assignment of rights) would apply
but for paragraph 8(2) (exclusion of cases where the original contract is itself a free-standing transfer).

P2para.Text: In this paragraph “the relevant land transaction” means the land transaction—

P3para.Text: mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)(a), or

in a case falling within sub-paragraph (1)(b), effected by the conveyance to the transferee of the subject-matter of the original contract or the substantial performance by the transferee of the original contract.

P2para.Text: References in this paragraph to “the specified transaction” are to—

P3para.Text: the free-standing transfer mentioned in paragraph 9(2), or
the original contract the subject-matter of which is conveyed to the transferee or which is substantially performed by the transferee.

P2para.Text: The general rule is that in relation to the relevant land transaction references in this Part of this Act to “the vendor” are to be read as references to the vendor or (as the case may be) transferor under the first appropriate transaction (but see sub-paragraph (5)).
In relation to the relevant land transaction, references to the vendor in the specified provisions (see sub-paragraph (6)) are to be read as including—

P3para.Text: the vendor under the first appropriate transaction, and
each person who is the transferor in the case of a relevant pre-completion transaction.

P2para.Text: The specified provisions are—

P3para.Text: section 61(1)(a) (compliance with planning obligations: conditions for exemption);
section 66(1) and (2) (transfers involving public bodies);
paragraph 8(1)(a) of Schedule 4 (debt as consideration);
paragraph 10(2)(c) of Schedule 4 (carrying out of works);
paragraph 16 of Schedule 4 (indemnity given by vendor).

P2para.Text: In determining under section 108(1) whether or not the relevant land transaction is linked to another transaction it may be assumed that any of the following is the vendor under the relevant land transaction—

P3para.Text: the vendor (determined under sub-paragraph (4)), or
the transferor under any relevant pre-completion transaction.

P2para.Text: The following are “relevant pre-completion transactions” in relation to the relevant land transaction—

P3para.Text: the specified transaction;
any other transaction that is a pre-completion transaction in relation to the original contract and has some subject-matter in common with the specified transaction.

P1group.Title: Paragraph 10: “the first appropriate transaction” and “the original contract”

P2para.Text: Subject to the following provisions of this paragraph, “the first appropriate transaction” means the original contract.

If the original contract is not performed at the same time as, and in connection with the performance of, the specified transaction, “the first appropriate transaction” means a transaction that is a pre-completion transaction in relation to the original contract and meets the following conditions.
The conditions are that the pre-completion transaction—

P3para.Text: is performed at the time when the specified transaction is performed and (if it is not itself the specified transaction) is performed in connection with the performance of the specified transaction,
is a transaction on which the entitlement of the transferee to call for the conveyance of the subject-matter of the specified transaction depends, and
is not preceded by another pre-completion transaction meeting the conditions in paragraphs (a) and (b).

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this paragraph—

P3para.Text: a contract for a land transaction is taken to be “performed” when it is substantially performed or completed (whichever is earlier);

a free-standing transfer other than a contract is taken to be “performed” when the transferee under that free-standing transfer (or an assignee of that transferee, as defined in paragraph 9(7)) acquires the subject-matter of that free-standing transfer.

P2para.Text: Where the specified transaction is a pre-completion transaction in relation to each of two or more contracts such as are mentioned in paragraph 1(1)(a) that together form a series of such contracts (each having some subject-matter in common with all the others), references in paragraph 10 and this paragraph to “the original contract” are to be read as references to the first contract in that series.
In this paragraph “the specified transaction” has the meaning given by paragraph 10(3).
This paragraph applies where either of the following provisions applies—

P3para.Text: paragraph 4(3) (assignment of rights: chargeable interest acquired or treated as acquired by transferee);
paragraph 9(2) (free-standing transfers: chargeable interest acquired or treated as acquired by transferee).

P2para.Text: If there is a relevant connection between parties, then for the purposes of paragraph 1(1) of Schedule 4 the consideration given by the purchaser for the subject-matter of the land transaction referred to in paragraph 4(4) or 9(2) is taken to be—

P3para.Text: the amount that it would be apart from this sub-paragraph, or
(if higher) the first minimum amount, or
(if higher than both those amounts) the second minimum amount.

P2para.Text: There is a “relevant connection between parties” if—

P3para.Text: the persons who are the transferor and transferee in relation to the pre-completion transaction mentioned in paragraph 4(1) or 9(1) (“the implemented transaction”) are connected with each other, or are not acting at arm’s length, or
sub-paragraph (4) applies.

P2para.Text: This sub-paragraph applies if—

P3para.Text: the implemented transaction is one in a chain of successive transactions (all having at least part of their subject-matter in common) that are pre-completion transactions in relation to the original contract, and

a person who is the transferor in relation to a pre-completion transaction that precedes the implemented transaction in the chain of transactions is connected with, or not acting at arm’s length in relation to, the transferee under the implemented transaction.

P2para.Text: Where the implemented transaction is a pre-completion transaction in relation to—

P3para.Text: a contract for a land transaction that is not itself a free-standing transfer in relation to any other contract, and
a contract, or two or more successive contracts, that are themselves free-standing transfers in relation to the contract mentioned in paragraph (a),

P2para.Text: references in this paragraph to “the original contract” are to the contract mentioned in paragraph (a) (and do not include any contract mentioned in paragraph (b)).
“The first minimum amount” means—

P3para.Text: if the chargeable interest acquired (or treated as acquired) under the land transaction referred to in paragraph 4(4) or 9(2) is the whole subject-matter of the original contract, the amount of any consideration (in money or money’s worth) agreed to be given, under the terms of the original contract, for the acquisition of that subject-matter, or
if paragraph (a) does not apply, so much of the amount mentioned in paragraph (a) as is referable, on a just and reasonable apportionment, to the chargeable interest mentioned in that paragraph.

P2para.Text: This is subject to sub-paragraph (2).
If conditions A to C are met, “the first minimum amount” means the amount of any consideration (in money or money’s worth) agreed, under the terms of the transfer to the first T, to be given in
respect of the subject-matter of that transaction (including any consideration relating to an obligation of the transferor under the transfer to the first T).
The conditions mentioned in sub-paragraph (2) are as follows.

Para.Text: Condition A is that the pre-completion transaction referred to in paragraph 4(4) or 9(2) is one of a chain of successive transactions (all having at least part of their subject-matter in common) that are pre-completion transactions in relation to the original contract.
Condition B is that a person (“T”) is the transferor under a pre-completion transaction that forms part of that chain and T is connected with, or not acting at arm’s length in relation to—
the transferee under that transaction, or
the transferee under a subsequent transaction in the chain.

Condition C is that having regard to all the circumstances it would not be reasonable to conclude that the obtaining of a tax advantage (for any person) was the main purpose, or one of main purposes, of T in entering into—
any pre-completion transaction in the chain, or
any arrangements of which such a transaction forms part.

P2para.Text: Where conditions A to C are met, “the first T” means—

P3para.Text: if condition B is met in relation to only one pre-completion transaction, T, or

if condition B is met in relation to more than one pre-completion transaction in the chain, the transferor in relation to the first of the pre-completion transactions in relation to which condition B is met.

P2para.Text: In this paragraph “the transfer to the first T” means—

P3para.Text: the pre-completion transaction under which the first T is the transferee, or
the original contract (if T is the original purchaser).

P2para.Text: In this paragraph—

P3para.Text: references to “the original contract” are to be read in accordance with paragraph 12(5) (and references to the original purchaser are to be read accordingly);
“tax advantage” has the same meaning as in paragraph 18.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 12 “the second minimum amount” means the total of the net amounts of consideration given by the relevant parties.
The net amount of consideration given by any relevant party is—

Para.Text: where—
CP is the total amount of consideration given by the party for the acquisition of the chargeable interest or as consideration for a pre-completion transaction;

P2para.Text: If CR is greater than CP, the net amount of consideration given by the relevant party is taken to be zero.
Except where sub-paragraph (4) applies, the relevant parties for the purposes of this paragraph are—

P3para.Text: the original purchaser, and
the transferee.

P2para.Text: If the pre-completion transaction referred to in paragraph 4(4) or 9(2) (“the implemented transaction”) is one in a chain of successive transactions (having at least part of their subject-matter in common) that are pre-completion transactions in relation to the original contract, only the following are relevant parties—

P3para.Text: the persons who are the transferor and transferee in relation to the implemented transaction;
a person who is the transferor in relation to preceding transaction, if that person is connected with, or not acting at arm’s length in relation to, the transferee under the implemented transaction,
the transferee under a pre-completion transaction, if the transferor is a relevant party (whether by virtue of this paragraph (c) or otherwise).

P2para.Text: For the purposes of sub-paragraph (2)—

P3para.Text: amounts given by a person connected with a relevant party are treated as given by the relevant party;
amounts given to a person connected with a relevant party are treated as given to the relevant party.

P2para.Text: References in this paragraph to a person connected with a relevant party do not include a person who is a relevant party.
If the subject-matter of the implemented transaction is not the whole subject-matter of the original contract—

P3para.Text: the amounts that are taken for the purposes of sub-paragraph (2) to be given “for the acquisition of the chargeable interest” are to be determined on a just and reasonable basis, and

only so much of the consideration for a preceding transaction as is referable, on a just and reasonable apportionment, to the subject-matter of the implemented transaction is taken into account under sub-paragraph (2).

P2para.Text: In this paragraph—

P3para.Text: references to “the original contract” are to be read in accordance with paragraph 12(5) (and references to “the original purchaser” are to be read accordingly);

“preceding transaction” means a pre-completion transaction that precedes the implemented transaction in a chain of successive pre-completion transactions (all having at least part of their subject-matter in common).

P1group.Title: Relief for original purchaser: assignment of rights

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where—

P3para.Text: a person would, in the absence of this paragraph, be liable to pay tax in respect of a notional land transaction deemed to take place under paragraph 5(1) or an additional land transaction deemed to take place under paragraph 5(2), and
the original contract had not been substantially performed when the assignment of rights mentioned in paragraph 4(1) was entered into.

P2para.Text: If the purchaser claims relief under this paragraph in respect of the notional land transaction or additional land transaction, no liability to tax arises in respect of that transaction.
Sub-paragraph (2) does not apply if the land transaction mentioned in paragraph 4(4) is exempt from charge by virtue of any of sections 71A to 73 (which relate to alternative property finance).
Relief under this section must be claimed in a land transaction return or an amendment of such a return.

P1group.Title: Relief for original purchaser: qualifying subsales

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies if—

P3para.Text: the pre-completion transaction is a qualifying subsale,

the original purchaser would, in the absence of this paragraph, be liable to pay tax in respect of a land transaction effected by the completion of the original contract or deemed to be effected by the substantial performance of the original contract,
the performance of the qualifying subsale takes place at the same time as, and in connection with, the performance of the original contract, and
relief is claimed in respect of the land transaction mentioned in paragraph (b).

P2para.Text: If the subject-matter of the qualifying subsale is the whole of the subject-matter of the original contract, no liability to tax arises in respect of the land transaction.
If the subject-matter of the qualifying subsale is part (but not the whole) of the subject-matter of the original contract, the amount of the consideration for the land transaction is taken to be—

P3para.Text: the amount that it would be apart from this subsection, less
so much of that amount as is referable to the subject-matter of the qualifying subsale.

P2para.Text: The amount mentioned in sub-paragraph (3)(a) may be reduced more than once under sub-paragraph (3) if there is more than one qualifying subsale.
Sub-paragraphs (2) to (4) do not apply if—

P3para.Text: the original contract had been substantially performed when the qualifying subsale was entered into, or
the transaction effected, or deemed to be effected, by the performance of the qualifying subsale is exempt from charge by virtue of any of sections 71A to 73.

P2para.Text: Relief under this section must be claimed in a land transaction return or an amendment of a land transaction return.
For the purposes of this paragraph a contract for a land transaction is taken to be “performed” when it is substantially performed or completed (whichever is earlier).

A pre-completion transaction is a “qualifying subsale” if it is a contract under which the original purchaser contracts to sell the whole or part of the subject-matter of the original contract to the transferee.

P1group.Title: Application of paragraph 16 to successive subsales

P1para.Text: If a transaction is a qualifying subsale in relation to more than one contract such as is mentioned in paragraph 1(1)(a), paragraph 16 is to be applied separately in relation to each such original contract for the purpose of determining what relief, if any, may be available with respect to the land transaction in question.

P2para.Text: Relief may not be claimed—

P3para.Text: under paragraph 15 if the assignment of rights referred to in sub-paragraph (1)(b) of that paragraph forms part of any tax avoidance arrangements, or
under paragraph 16 if the qualifying subsale referred to in sub-paragraph (1)(c) of that paragraph forms part of any tax avoidance arrangements.

P2para.Text: Arrangements are “tax avoidance arrangements” if, having regard to all the circumstances, it would be reasonable to conclude that the obtaining of a tax advantage for the original purchaser or any other person was the main purpose, or one of the main purposes, of the original purchaser in entering into the arrangements.
In this paragraph “tax advantage” means—

P3para.Text: a relief from tax or increased relief from tax,
a repayment of tax or increased repayment of tax,
the avoidance or reduction of a charge to tax, or
the avoidance of a possible assessment to tax.

P2para.Text: In this paragraph “arrangements” includes any agreement, understanding, scheme, transaction or series of transactions (whether or not legally enforceable).
Nothing in paragraphs 12 to 14 (minimum consideration rule) or this paragraph affects the breadth of the application of sections 75A to 75C (anti-avoidance).

P1group.Title: Exclusion of transactions from duty to make returns etc

P2para.Text: The Treasury may by regulations amend this Schedule, or any provision of this Part of this Act relating to the making of returns, so as to—

P3para.Text: exempt relevant purchasers of any specified description, or in specified circumstances, from the duty to deliver a land transaction return,
provide for relief under paragraph 15 or 16 to be available without a claim in the case of any specified class of transactions, or
provide that paragraph 5 does not apply in specified cases.

P2para.Text: In this paragraph “relevant purchaser” means a person who is the transferor under a pre-completion transaction.

P1para.Text: Section 1122 of CTA 2010 (connected persons) applies for the purposes of this Schedule.

P2para.Text: In this Schedule—

Para.Text: “assignment of rights” has the meaning given by paragraph 2(1);
“contract” includes any agreement;
“conveyance” includes any instrument;
“free-standing transfer” has the meaning given by paragraph 2(2);
“pre-completion transaction” (in relation to a contract such as is mentioned in paragraph 1(1)) has the meaning given by paragraph 1(2);
“qualifying subsale” has the meaning given by paragraph 16(8);
“the transferee”, in relation to a pre-completion transaction, has the meaning given by paragraph 1(2)(a);
“the transferor”, in relation to a pre-completion transaction, has the meaning given by paragraph 2(3).

P2para.Text: In this Schedule—

P3para.Text: references to “the original contract” are to be read in accordance with paragraph 1(1)(a);
references to “the original purchaser” are to be read in accordance with paragraph 1(1)(a) and see also sub-paragraph (3);
references to “part of the subject-matter of the original contract” are to be read in accordance with paragraph 1(7);
references to the “subject-matter” of a pre-completion transaction are to be read in accordance with paragraph 2(4);
references to substantial performance of the original contract “by the transferee” (in cases involving an assignment of rights) are to be read in accordance with paragraph 4(7).

P2para.Text: For any one contract for the acquisition of a chargeable interest there is only one original purchaser (disregarding cases involving joint purchasers).

P1para.Text: In section 57A (sale and leaseback arrangements), in subsection (3)(c)—

P3para.Text: omit “section 45 (contract and conveyance: effect of transfer of rights) or”, and
after the second occurrence of “transfer of rights)” insert “or a pre-completion transaction within the meaning of Schedule 2A (transactions entered into before completion of contract)”.

P1para.Text: In section 77 (notifiable transactions), in subsection (1)—

P3para.Text: omit the “or” after paragraph (c), and
after paragraph (d) insert, “or
a notional or additional land transaction under paragraph 5 of Schedule 2A.

P1para.Text: In section 79(2) (registration of land transactions etc)—

P3para.Text: omit paragraph (a)(i) and the “or” after it, and
after paragraph (b) insert—
under paragraph 5 of Schedule 2A (transactions entered into before completion of contract),

P1para.Text: In section 119 (meaning of “effective date” of a transaction), in subsection (2), at the appropriate place insert—

Para.Text: paragraph 5 of Schedule 2A,

P1para.Text: In section 121 (index of defined expressions), in the entry for “vendor”, in the second column, for “sections 45(5A) and 45A(9)” substitute “section 45A(9) and paragraphs 8, 10 and 11 of Schedule 2A”.
In Schedule 6B (transfers involving multiple dwellings), in paragraph 7(6), in the definition of “relevant deeming provision”, after “45A” insert “or paragraph 5(1) or (3) of Schedule 2A”.

In paragraph 12B of Schedule 17A (assignment of agreement for lease), in sub-paragraph (1) for “section 45 (contract and conveyance: effect of transfer of rights)” substitute “Schedule 2A (transactions entered into before completion of contract)”.

The amendments made by this Schedule have effect in relation to transfers of rights (see section 45 of FA 2003) and pre-completion transactions (see paragraph 3) entered into on or after the day on which this Act is passed.

TitleBlock.Title: Stamp duty land tax: relief from 15% rate

P1para.Text: Part 4 of FA 2003 (stamp duty land tax) is amended as follows.

P2para.Text: Schedule 4A (higher rate for certain transactions) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 2(6) (treatment of certain transactions as two separate chargeable transactions) for “and 5” substitute “, 5 to 5K and 6A to 6H”.
For paragraph 5 (property developers) and the cross-heading preceding it substitute—

P1group.Title: Businesses of letting, trading in or redeveloping properties

P2para.Text: Paragraph 3 does not apply to a chargeable transaction so far as its subject-matter consists of a higher threshold interest that is acquired exclusively for one or more of the following purposes—

P3para.Text: exploitation as a source of rents or other receipts (other than excluded rents) in the course of a qualifying property rental business;
development or redevelopment and resale in the course of a property development trade;
resale in the course of a property development trade (in a case where the chargeable transaction is part of a qualifying exchange);
resale (as stock of the business) in the course of a property trading business.

P2para.Text: A chargeable interest does not count as being acquired exclusively for one or more of those purposes if it is intended that a non-qualifying individual will be permitted to occupy the dwelling.
In this paragraph—

Para.Text: “excluded rents” has the same meaning as in section 131 of the Finance Act 2013;
“property development trade” means a trade that—
consists of or includes buying and developing or redeveloping for resale residential or non-residential property, and
is run on a commercial basis and with a view to profit;
“part of a qualifying exchange” is to be construed in accordance with section 137(4) of the Finance Act 2013;
“property trading business” means a business that—
consists of or includes activities in the nature of a trade of buying and selling dwellings, and
is run on a commercial basis and with a view to profit;
“qualifying property rental business” has the same meaning as in section 131 of the Finance Act 2013.

P2para.Text: After paragraph 5 insert—
In paragraph 5 “non-qualifying individual”, in relation to a chargeable transaction, means any of the following—

P3para.Text: the purchaser (other than a purchaser entering into the transaction as a member of a partnership);
a purchaser who enters into the transaction as a member of a partnership and has a major share in the partnership,
an individual (a “connected person”) who is connected with the purchaser;
a relevant settlor;
the spouse or civil partner of a connected person or of a relevant settlor;
a relative of a connected person or of a relevant settlor, or the spouse or civil partner of a relative of a connected person or of a relevant settlor;
a relative of the spouse or civil partner of a connected person or of a relevant settlor;
the spouse or civil partner of a person falling within paragraph (g);
an individual who is a major participant in a relevant collective investment scheme or is connected with a major participant in a relevant collective investment scheme.

P2para.Text: A member of a partnership has a “major share” in the partnership if the member is entitled to a 50% or greater share—

P3para.Text: in the income profits of the partnership, or
in the partnership’s assets.

P2para.Text: A collective investment scheme is a “relevant collective investment scheme” for the purposes of sub-paragraph (1)(i) if the purchaser under the chargeable transaction referred to in that sub-paragraph acquires the subject-matter of the transaction for the purposes of that scheme.
An individual who participates in a collective investment scheme is a “major participant” in the scheme if the individual—

P3para.Text: is entitled to a share of at least 50% either of all the profits or income arising from the scheme or of any profits or income arising from the scheme that may be distributed to participants, or
would in the event of the winding up of the scheme be entitled to 50% or more of the assets of the scheme that would then be available for distribution among the participants.

P2para.Text: The reference in sub-paragraph (4)(a) to profits or income arising from a collective investment scheme is to profits or income arising from the acquisition, holding, management or disposal of the property subject to the scheme.
In this paragraph—

Para.Text: “participant”, in relation to a collective investment scheme, is to be read in accordance with section 235 of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000;
“relative” means brother, sister, ancestor or lineal descendant;
“relevant settlor”, in relation to a chargeable transaction, means an individual who is a settlor in relation to a relevant settlement (as defined in sub-paragraph (6));
“settlement” has the same meaning as in Chapter 5 of Part 5 of ITTOIA 2005 (see section 620 of that Act).

P2para.Text: Where a person, in the capacity of trustee of a settlement, is connected with a person who is the purchaser under a chargeable transaction, that settlement is a “relevant settlement” in relation to the chargeable transaction.
In sub-paragraph (7) “trustee” is to be read in accordance with section 1123(3) of CTA 2010 (“connected persons”: supplementary).
In this paragraph “the purchaser”, in relation to a chargeable transaction, is to be read as a reference to any of the purchasers (if there are more than one).
Section 1122 of the Corporation Tax Act 2010 (connected persons) has effect for the purposes of this paragraph, but for those purposes—

P3para.Text: subsections (7) and (8) of that section (application of rules about connected persons to partnerships) are to be disregarded, and
subsections (2) to (7) of section 170 of the Finance Act 2013 apply as they apply for the purposes of Part 3 of that Act.

P1group.Title: Trades involving making a dwelling available to the public

P2para.Text: Paragraph 3 does not apply to a chargeable transaction so far as its subject-matter consists of a higher threshold interest in relation to which the conditions in sub-paragraph (2) are met.
The conditions are that—

P3para.Text: the higher threshold interest is acquired with the intention that it will be exploited as a source of income in the course of a qualifying trade, and
reasonable commercial plans have been formulated to carry out that intention without delay (except so far as delay may be justified by commercial considerations or cannot be avoided).

P2para.Text: “Qualifying trade”, in relation to a higher threshold interest, means a trade that—

P3para.Text: is carried on on a commercial basis and with a view to profit, and
involves, in its normal course, offering the public the opportunity to make use of, stay in or otherwise enjoy the dwelling as customers of the trade on at least 28 days in any calendar year.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of sub-paragraph (3), persons are not considered to have the opportunity to make use of, stay in or otherwise enjoy a dwelling unless the areas that they have the opportunity to make use of, stay in or otherwise enjoy include a significant part of the interior of the dwelling.

The size (relative to the size of the whole dwelling), nature and function of any relevant area or areas in a dwelling are taken into account in determining whether they form a significant part of the interior of the dwelling.

P1group.Title: Financial institutions acquiring dwellings in the course of lending

P2para.Text: Sub-paragraph (2) applies to a chargeable transaction if the purchaser is a financial institution carrying on a business that involves the lending of money.
Paragraph 3 does not apply to the chargeable transaction so far as its subject-matter consists of a higher threshold interest that is acquired in the course of that business—

P3para.Text: for the purpose of resale in the course of the business and,
in connection with those lending activities.

P1group.Title: Dwellings for occupation by certain employees etc

P2para.Text: Paragraph 3 does not apply to a chargeable transaction so far as its subject-matter consists of a higher threshold interest in relation to which the conditions in sub-paragraph (2) are met.
The conditions are that—

P3para.Text: the interest is acquired for the purpose of making the dwelling available to one or more qualifying employees or qualifying partners for use as living accommodation, and
the dwelling is to be made available as mentioned in paragraph (a) for purposes that are solely or mainly purposes of the qualifying trade.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of the relief under this paragraph it does not matter whether or not the individuals mentioned in sub-paragraph (2)(a) are identified at the time of the chargeable transaction.
“Relievable trade” means a trade that is carried on on a commercial basis and with a view to profit.

In this paragraph references to making a dwelling available to a qualifying individual include making it available to persons who are to share the accommodation with a qualifying individual as that individual’s family.

Where the purchaser is a company, “relevant group member” means a company which is a member of the same group of companies as the purchaser for the purposes mentioned in paragraph 1(2) of Schedule 7 (group relief).

P1group.Title: More about the condition in paragraph 5D(2)(a)

P2para.Text: In a case where the person carrying on the qualifying trade mentioned in paragraph 5D(1) carries it on in partnership with one or more other persons, “qualifying partner” means any individual who is a member of the partnership.
“Qualifying employee” means an individual employed for the purposes of the qualifying trade.

In a case falling within sub-paragraph (1), the condition in paragraph 5D(2)(a) is taken not to be met if the individuals, or a class of individuals, to whom it is proposed to make the dwelling available for use as living accommodation include, or are likely to include, a member of the partnership who is (or will at the relevant time be) entitled to a 10% or greater share—

P3para.Text: in the income profits of the partnership, or
in any company beneficially entitled to the higher threshold interest mentioned in paragraph 5D(1), or
in that higher threshold interest.

P2para.Text: In addition, the condition in paragraph 5D(2)(a) is taken not to be met if the individuals, or a class of individuals, to whom it is proposed to make the dwelling available for use as living accommodation include, or are likely to include, an individual employed for the purposes of the trade in question who is (or will at the relevant time be)—

P3para.Text: entitled to a 10% or greater share—

P4para.Text: in the income profits of the trade, or
in any company that is beneficially entitled to the higher threshold interest, or
in that higher threshold interest, or

P3para.Text: employed to provide excluded domestic services.

P2para.Text: The reference in sub-paragraph (4)(b) to an individual employed to provide excluded domestic services is to an individual the duties of whose employment include the provision of services in connection with the (actual or intended) occupation, by an individual to whom sub-paragraph (6) applies, of the dwelling mentioned in paragraph 5D(2)(a) (“the relevant dwelling”), or a linked dwelling.
This sub-paragraph applies to any individual who is connected with a person who is or is to be beneficially entitled to the higher threshold interest.
The following are “linked” dwellings for the purposes of sub-paragraph (5)—

P3para.Text: if the conditions in section 114(2) of the Finance Act 2013 are met in relation to the relevant dwelling and another dwelling, that other dwelling;
a dwelling that is linked to the relevant dwelling, as described in section 115(1) of the Finance Act 2013.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of sub-paragraphs (3)(c) and (4)(a) persons who are entitled to a chargeable interest as beneficial joint tenants (or,
in Scotland, as joint owners) are taken to be entitled to the chargeable interest as beneficial tenants in common (or, in Scotland, as owners in common) in equal shares.
Section 145 of the Finance Act 2013 (meaning of “10% or greater share in a company”) applies for the purposes of this paragraph as for the purposes of section 144 of that Act.
In this paragraph references to employment include the holding of an office.
Paragraph 3 does not apply to a chargeable transaction so far as its subject-matter consists of a higher threshold interest in or over a dwelling—

P3para.Text: that is, or is to be, a farmhouse, and
in relation to which the conditions in sub-paragraph (3) are met.

P2para.Text: The reference in sub-paragraph (1) to a dwelling that “is or is to be a farmhouse” is to a dwelling that forms part of land that is to be occupied, or to continue to be occupied, for the purposes of a qualifying trade of farming.
The conditions are that—

P3para.Text: the dwelling is to be occupied for the purposes of that trade by a qualifying farm worker,

reasonable commercial plans have been formulated under which such occupation is either to continue from the effective date of the chargeable transaction or to begin without delay (except so far as delay may be justified by commercial considerations or cannot be avoided), and
occupation of the farmhouse by a qualifying farm worker is then expected to continue as part of the normal way in which the trade is, or is to be, carried on.

P2para.Text: In sub-paragraph (3) “qualifying farm worker” means an individual who occupies the dwelling for the purposes of the trade mentioned in that sub-paragraph and has a substantial involvement—

P3para.Text: in the day-to-day work of the trade, or
in the direction and control of the conduct of the trade.

P2para.Text: “Qualifying trade of farming” means a trade of farming that is carried on—

P3para.Text: on a commercial basis, and
with a view to the realisation of profits.

P2para.Text: A person occupying part of a dwelling is regarded as occupying the dwelling for the purposes of this paragraph.
In this paragraph—

P3para.Text: “farming” has the same meaning as in the Corporation Tax Acts (see section 1125 of CTA 2010), except that in this paragraph “farming” includes market gardening;
“market gardening” has the same meaning as in the Corporation Tax Acts (see section 1125(5) of CTA 2010).

P2para.Text: Sub-paragraph (2) applies where relief under paragraph 5 has been allowed in respect of a higher threshold interest forming the whole or part of the subject-matter of a chargeable transaction.

The relief is withdrawn if at any time in the period of three years beginning with the effective date of the chargeable transaction (“the control period”) a requirement in sub-paragraph (3) is not met.
The requirements are that—

P3para.Text: the higher threshold interest (if still held by the purchaser) is held exclusively for one or more of the purposes mentioned in paragraph 5(1),
any chargeable interest derived from the higher threshold interest that may be held by the purchaser is held exclusively for one or more of those purposes, and
(if the higher threshold interest or a chargeable interest derived from it is held by the purchaser) no non-qualifying individual is permitted to occupy the dwelling.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3)(a) and (b) do not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the purchaser’s control, it is not reasonable to expect the purposes for which the higher threshold interest was acquired to be carried out.

Sub-paragraph (6) applies if a higher threshold interest was acquired for a purpose mentioned in paragraph 5(1) but at some time in the control period the activity in question (for instance, exploitation of the interest as mentioned in paragraph 5(1)(a))—

P3para.Text: has not yet begun, or
has ceased.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of sub-paragraph (3), the interest is taken to be held for the purpose in question only if reasonable steps are being taken to ensure that the purpose in question is carried out.
In this paragraph “non-qualifying individual” (in relation to the chargeable transaction mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)) has the meaning given by paragraph 5A.

This paragraph applies where relief under paragraph 5B (trades involving making a dwelling open to the public) has been allowed in respect of a higher threshold interest forming the whole or part of the subject-matter of a chargeable transaction.

The relief is withdrawn if at any time in the period of three years beginning with the effective date of the chargeable transaction (“the control period”) a requirement in sub-paragraph (3) is not met.
The requirements are that—

P3para.Text: the higher threshold interest (if still held by the purchaser), is being exploited as a source of income in the course of a qualifying trade, and
any chargeable interest derived from that interest that may be held by the purchaser is being exploited as mentioned in paragraph (a).

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3) do not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the purchaser’s control, it is not reasonable to expect the chargeable interest concerned to be exploited in the manner specified.
Sub-paragraph (6) applies if at some time in the control period the higher threshold interest, or a chargeable interest derived from it—

P3para.Text: has not begun to be exploited as mentioned in sub-paragraph (3), or
has ceased to be so exploited.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3) are treated as being met if reasonable steps are being taken to ensure that the chargeable interest in question begins to be exploited as mentioned in that sub-paragraph, or that such exploitation of the interest is resumed.

This paragraph applies where relief under paragraph 5C (financial institutions acquiring dwellings in the course of lending) has been allowed in respect of a higher threshold interest forming the whole or part of the subject-matter of a chargeable transaction.

The relief is withdrawn if any requirement in sub-paragraph (3) is not met at any time in the period of three years beginning with the effective date of the chargeable transaction (“the control period”) (but see sub-paragraphs (4) and (5)).
The requirements are that—

P3para.Text: the purchaser continues to be a financial institution carrying on a business that involves the lending of money, and
the interest is held for the purpose of resale in the course of the business.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3) apply only to times in the control period when the purchaser holds—

P3para.Text: the higher threshold interest, or
a chargeable interest that is derived from the higher threshold interest.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3) do not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the purchaser’s control, it is not reasonable to expect those requirements to be met.

This paragraph applies where relief under paragraph 5D (dwellings for occupation by certain employees etc) has been allowed in respect of a higher threshold interest forming the whole or part of the subject-matter of a chargeable transaction.

The relief is withdrawn if any requirement in sub-paragraph (3) is not met at any time in the period of three years beginning with the effective date of the chargeable transaction (“the control period”) (but see sub-paragraphs (4) and (5)).
The requirements are that—

P3para.Text: the purchaser, or a relevant group member (as defined in paragraph 5D(6)), carries on a trade on a commercial basis and with a view to profit,
the dwelling is made available as mentioned in paragraph 5D(2)(a), and
the dwelling is made so available for purposes that are solely or mainly purposes of the trade mentioned in paragraph (a) of this sub-paragraph.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3) apply only to times in the control period when the purchaser holds—

P3para.Text: the higher threshold interest, or
a chargeable interest that is derived from the higher threshold interest.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3) do not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the purchaser’s control, it is not reasonable to expect those requirements to be met.
Sub-paragraph (7) applies if at some time in the control period the dwelling—

P3para.Text: has not begun to be made available as mentioned in sub-paragraph (3)(b) and (c), or
has ceased to be so made available.

P2para.Text: The requirements in paragraphs (b) and (c) of sub-paragraph (3) are treated as being met if reasonable steps are being taken to ensure that the dwelling will begin to be, or will return to being, available as mentioned in those paragraphs.

This paragraph applies where relief under paragraph 5F (farmhouses) has been allowed in respect of a higher threshold interest forming the whole or part of the subject-matter of a chargeable transaction.

The relief is withdrawn if at any time in the period of three years beginning with the effective date of the chargeable transaction (“the control period”) the requirements in sub-paragraph (3) are not met (but see sub-paragraphs (4) and (5)).
The requirements are that—

P3para.Text: the land mentioned in paragraph 5F(2)(a) is occupied for the purposes of a qualifying trade of farming, and
the dwelling is occupied for the purposes of that trade by a qualifying farm worker.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3) apply only to times in the control period when the purchaser holds—

P3para.Text: the higher threshold interest, or
a chargeable interest that is derived from the higher threshold interest.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (3) do not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the purchaser’s control, it is not reasonable to expect those requirements to be met.
Sub-paragraph (7) applies if at some time in the control period a requirement in sub-paragraph (3)—

P3para.Text: has not begun to be met, or
has ceased to be met.

P2para.Text: The requirement is treated as being met if reasonable steps are being taken to ensure that the requirement begins to be met, or is again met.
After paragraph 6 insert—

P1group.Title: Modifications for cases involving alternative finance arrangements

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where—

P3para.Text: section 71A (land sold to financial institution and leased to person), section 72 (land sold in Scotland sold to financial institution and leased to person) or section 73 (land sold to financial institution and re-sold to person) applies, and
the major interest in land purchased under the first transaction consists of or includes a higher threshold interest.

P2para.Text: In this paragraph “the first transaction” means—

P3para.Text: where section 71A applies, the transaction mentioned in section 71A(1)(a);
where section 72 applies, the transaction mentioned in section 72(1)(a);
where section 73 applies, the transaction mentioned in section 73(1)(a)(i).

P2para.Text: The condition in paragraph 3(3) is treated as being met with respect to the first transaction only if that condition is met with respect to the second transaction.

If the second transaction would qualify for relief under any of paragraphs 5(1), 5B(1), 5D(1) and 5F(1) (disregarding the exemptions in sections 71A(3), 72(3) and 73(3) and assuming, for this purpose, that the subject-matter of the second transaction is a higher threshold interest), the first transaction is taken to qualify for relief under the same provision (and accordingly paragraph 3 does not apply in relation to the first transaction).
The first transaction does not qualify for relief under any of paragraphs 5(1), 5B(1), 5D(1) or 5F(1) except in accordance with sub-paragraph (4).
In this paragraph “the second transaction” has the same meaning as in section 71A, 72 or 73 (as the case requires).

This paragraph applies where section 72A (land in Scotland sold to financial institution and person in common) applies and the major interest in land purchased under the transaction mentioned in section 72A(1)(a) (“the first transaction”) consists of or includes a higher threshold interest.

In determining whether or not the first transaction meets the condition in paragraph 3(3) it is to be assumed that the financial institution referred to in section 72A(1) is not one of the persons acquiring the major interest in land under that transaction.
Paragraphs 5 to 5F have effect in relation to the first transaction as they would have effect if the financial institution were not a purchaser under that transaction.

P1group.Title: Paragraphs 6A and 6B: application where transaction is split under paragraph 2(3)

P2para.Text: Where paragraph 6A or 6B (“the modifying paragraph”) applies and the first transaction (within the meaning of that paragraph) is treated under paragraph 2(3) as two separate chargeable transactions, references in the modifying paragraph to the first transaction include those separate transactions.

If the subject-matter of the second transaction (within the meaning of paragraph 6A) includes a chargeable interest other than a higher threshold interest, that fact is ignored in determining for the purposes of paragraph 6A—

P3para.Text: whether that transaction meets the condition in paragraph 3(3), or
whether it would qualify for relief under any of paragraphs 5(1), 5B(1), 5D(1) and 5F(1).

P1group.Title: Alternative finance arrangements: withdrawal of relief

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where relief under paragraph 5 (businesses of letting, trading in or developing properties) has been allowed, in accordance with paragraph 6A(4) or 6B(3), with respect to the purchase of a major interest in land.
The relief is withdrawn if at any time in the period of three years beginning with the effective date of the first transaction (“the control period”) a relevant requirement is not met.
The relevant requirements are that—

P3para.Text: any relevant interest (see sub-paragraphs (5) and (6)) held by the relevant person is held by that person exclusively for one or more of the purposes mentioned in paragraph 5(1), and
(if a relevant interest is held by the relevant person) no non-qualifying individual is permitted to occupy the dwelling.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of sub-paragraph (3)(a) and (b) it does not matter whether the relevant interest is held by the relevant person—

P3para.Text: jointly or (in Scotland) in common, or
otherwise.

P2para.Text: In relation to relief allowed in accordance with sub-paragraph 6A(4), “relevant interest” means any of the following—

P3para.Text: the interest acquired under the second transaction (within the meaning of paragraph 6A);
any interest transferred to the relevant person as a result of the exercise of the right mentioned in section 71A(1)(d) or 72(1)(c);
any chargeable interest derived from an interest such as is mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b).

P2para.Text: In relation to relief allowed in accordance with paragraph 6B(3), “relevant interest” means any of the following—

P3para.Text: the interest purchased under the first transaction (within the meaning of paragraph 6B);
any interest transferred to the relevant person as a result of the exercise of the right mentioned in section 72A(1)(c);
any chargeable interest derived from an interest such as is mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b).

P2para.Text: In this paragraph—

Para.Text: “non-qualifying individual” (in relation to the chargeable transaction mentioned in sub-paragraph (1)) has the meaning given by paragraph 5A;
“the relevant person” means the person (other than the financial institution) who entered into the arrangements in question as mentioned in section 71A(1), 72(1), 72A(1) or 73(1).

P2para.Text: The requirement in paragraph 6D(3)(a) does not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the relevant person’s control, it is not reasonable to expect the interest in question to be held for the purpose for which the relevant person acquired that person’s initial interest.

Sub-paragraph (3) applies if the relevant person’s initial interest was acquired by the relevant person for a purpose mentioned in paragraph 5(1), but at some time in the control period the activity in question (for instance, exploitation as mentioned in paragraph 5(1)(a))—

P3para.Text: has not begun in the case of a relevant interest, or
has ceased in the case of a relevant interest.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 6D(3)(a) the relevant interest is taken to be held for the purpose in question only if reasonable steps are being taken to ensure that the purpose in question is carried out.
In this paragraph—

P3para.Text: “the control period”, “relevant interest” and “the relevant person” have the same meaning as in paragraph 6D;
references to the relevant person’s “initial interest” are to the interest mentioned in sub-paragraph (5)(a) or (6)(a) of paragraph 6D (as the case requires).

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where relief under paragraph 5B (trades involving making a dwelling open to the public) has been allowed, in accordance with paragraph 6A(4) or 6B(3), with respect to the purchase of a major interest in land.
The relief is withdrawn if at any time in the period of three years beginning with the effective date of the first transaction (“the control period”) the requirement in sub-paragraph (3) is not met.
The requirement is that the dwelling is being exploited as a source of income in the course of a qualifying trade.

The requirement in sub-paragraph (3) does not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the relevant person’s control, it is not reasonable to expect the interest in question to be exploited as mentioned in that sub-paragraph.
Sub-paragraph (6) applies if at some time in the control period that person—

P3para.Text: has not begun to exploit the interest as a source of income in the course of a relevant trade, or
has ceased so to exploit it.

P2para.Text: The requirement in sub-paragraph (3) is treated as being met if reasonable steps are being taken to ensure that the relevant interest begins to be exploited as mentioned in that sub-paragraph, or that such exploitation of the interest is resumed.
In this paragraph—

P3para.Text: “the relevant person” means the person (other than the financial institution) who enters into the arrangements mentioned in section 71A(1), 72(1), 72A(1) or 73(1);
references to a major interest in land include an undivided share in a major interest in land.

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where relief under paragraph 5D (dwellings for occupation by certain employees etc) has been allowed, in accordance with paragraph 6A(4) or 6B(3), with respect to the purchase of a major interest in land.

The relief is withdrawn if at any time in the control period when the relevant person holds a relevant interest (whether jointly, or in common, or otherwise) any requirement in sub-paragraph (4) is not met.
In sub-paragraph (2) “the control period” means the three years beginning with the effective date of the first transaction.
The requirements are that—

P3para.Text: the relevant person, or a relevant group member, carries on a qualifying trade,
the dwelling is made available as mentioned in paragraph 5D(2)(a), and
the dwelling is made so available for purposes that are solely or mainly purposes of the trade mentioned in sub-paragraph (a).

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (4) do not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the relevant person’s control, it is not reasonable to expect those requirements to be met.
Sub-paragraph (7) applies if at some time in the control period the relevant interest—

P3para.Text: has not begun to be made available as mentioned in sub-paragraph (4)(b) and (c), or
has ceased to be so made available.

P2para.Text: The requirements in paragraphs (b) and (c) of sub-paragraph (4) are treated as being met if reasonable steps are being taken to ensure that the dwelling will begin to be, or will return to being, made available as mentioned in those paragraphs.

Where the relevant person is a company, “relevant group member” means a company which is a member of the same group of companies as the relevant person for the purposes mentioned in paragraph 1(2) of Schedule 7.
In this paragraph—

P3para.Text: “relevant interest” has the same meaning as in paragraph 6D;
“the relevant person” means the person (other than the financial institution) who enters into the arrangements mentioned in section 71A(1), 72(1), 72A(1) or 73(1);
references to a major interest in land include an undivided share in a major interest in land.

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where relief under paragraph 5F (farmhouses) has been allowed, in accordance with paragraph 6A(4) or 6B(3), in relation to the purchase of a major interest in land.

The relief is withdrawn if at any time in the control period when the relevant person holds a relevant interest (whether jointly, or in common, or otherwise) any requirement in sub-paragraph (4) is not met.
In sub-paragraph (2) “the control period” means the three years beginning with the effective date of the first transaction.
The requirements are that—

P3para.Text: the land mentioned in paragraph 5F(2) is occupied for the purposes of a qualifying trade of farming, and
the dwelling is occupied for the purposes of that trade by a qualifying farm worker.

P2para.Text: The requirements in sub-paragraph (4) do not apply in relation to times when, because of a change of circumstances that is unforeseen and beyond the relevant person’s control, it is not reasonable to expect those requirements to be met.
Sub-paragraph (7) applies if at some time in the control period a requirement in sub-paragraph (4)—

P3para.Text: has not begun to be met, or
has ceased to be met.

P2para.Text: The requirement is treated as being met if reasonable steps are being taken to ensure that the requirement begins to be met, or is again met.
In this paragraph—

P3para.Text: “the relevant interest” has the same meaning as in paragraph 6D;
“the relevant person” means the person (other than the financial institution) who enters into the arrangements mentioned in section 71A(1), 72(1), 72A(1) or 73(1);
references to a major interest in land include an undivided share in a major interest in land.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 9 (interpretation), at the appropriate places insert—

Para.Text: “financial institution” has the same meaning as in sections 71A to 73B (see section 73BA);”
““property development trade” has the meaning given by paragraph 5(3);”
““property rental business” has the meaning given by section 131(4) of the Finance Act 2013;”
““property trading business” has the meaning given by paragraph 5(3);”
““qualifying farm worker” has the meaning given by paragraph 5F(4);”
““qualifying trade” has the meaning given by paragraph 5B(3);”
““qualifying trade of farming” has the meaning given by paragraph 5F(5);

P2para.Text: Section 81 (further return where relief withdrawn) is amended as follows.
After subsection (1) insert—

Where relief is withdrawn to any extent under any of paragraphs 5G to 5K of Schedule 4A (higher rate for certain transactions) the purchaser must deliver a further return before the end of the period of 30 days after the relevant date.
In subsection (1A) “the relevant date” means—

P3para.Text: in the case of relief under paragraph 5 of Schedule 4A (businesses of letting, trading in or redeveloping properties), the first day in the period mentioned in paragraph 5G(2) on which a requirement under paragraph 5G(3) was not met in the case of the chargeable interest in question;

in the case of relief under paragraph 5B of that Schedule (trades involving making a dwelling available to the public), the first day in the period mentioned in paragraph 5H(2) on which a requirement under paragraph 5H(3) was not met in the case of the chargeable interest in question;
in the case of relief under paragraph 5C of that Schedule (financial institutions acquiring dwellings in the course of lending), the first day in the period mentioned in paragraph
5I(2) on which a requirement under paragraph 5I(3) was not met in the case of the chargeable interest in question;

in the case of relief under paragraph 5D of that Schedule (dwellings for occupation by certain employees etc), the first day in the period mentioned in paragraph 5J(2) on which a requirement under paragraph 5J(3) was not met in the case of the chargeable interest in question;

in the case of relief under paragraph 5F of that Schedule (farmhouses), the first day in the period mentioned in paragraph 5K(2) on which a requirement under paragraph 5K(3) was not met in the case of the chargeable interest in question.

P2para.Text: In subsection (2A), for “Tax” substitute “Where subsection (1) applies any tax”.
In subsection (3) for “this section” substitute “subsection (1)”.
After subsection (4) insert—

The provisions of Schedule 10 apply to a return under subsection (1A) as they apply to a return under section 76, but with the adaptation that references to the effective date of the transaction are to be read as references to the relevant date (as defined in subsection (1B)).

P1para.Text: After section 81 insert—

P1group.Title: Alternative finance arrangements: return where relief withdrawn

P2para.Text: Where relief given in respect of a transaction entered into under alternative finance arrangements is withdrawn to any extent under any of paragraphs 6D, 6F, 6G or 6H of Schedule 4A (higher rate of tax: alternative finance arrangements)—

P3para.Text: the relevant person must deliver a return to HMRC before the end of the period of 30 days after the date of the disqualifying event;
the return must contain a self-assessment of the additional tax chargeable as a result of the withdrawal of the relief;
the tax so chargeable is calculated by reference to the rates in force at the effective date of the transaction in respect of which the relief was allowed.

P2para.Text: The provisions of Schedule 10 (returns, enquiries, assessments and other matters) apply to a return under this section as they apply to a return under section 76 (general requirement to make land transaction return), but with the following adaptations—

P3para.Text: references to the effective date of the transaction are to be read as references to the date of the disqualifying event;

references to the purchaser are to be read as references to the relevant person so far as that is necessary as a result of subsection (1) of this section or section 85(3) (payment of additional tax by relevant person where relief withdrawn).

P2para.Text: In this section “the date of the disqualifying event” means the first day in the control period on which a relevant requirement was not met.
In subsection (3) “relevant requirement” means—

P3para.Text: where the relief was given under paragraph 5 of Schedule 4A (businesses of letting, trading in or redeveloping properties), a requirement under paragraph 5G(3) of that Schedule;
where the relief was given under paragraph 5B of that Schedule (trades involving making a dwelling available to the public), a requirement under paragraph 5H(3) of that Schedule;
where the relief was given under paragraph 5C of that Schedule (financial institutions acquiring dwellings in the course of lending), a requirement under paragraph 5I(3) of that Schedule;
where the relief was given under paragraph 5D of that Schedule (dwellings for occupation by certain employees etc), a requirement under paragraph 5J(3) of that Schedule;
where the relief was given under paragraph 5F of that Schedule (farmhouses), a requirement under paragraph 5K(3) of that Schedule.

P2para.Text: In subsection (3) “the control period” has the same meaning as in paragraph 5G, 5H, 5I, 5J or 5K (as the case requires) of Schedule 4A.
In this section—

Para.Text: “alternative finance arrangements” means any arrangements such as are mentioned in section 71A, 72, 72A or 73;
“the relevant person” means the person (other than the financial institution) who entered into the arrangements in question.

P1para.Text: In section 85 (liability for tax), after subsection (2) insert—

P2para.Text: Where relief given in respect of a transaction entered into under alternative finance arrangements is withdrawn to any extent under any of paragraphs 6D, 6F, 6G and 6H of Schedule 4A (higher rate: alternative finance arrangements)—

P3para.Text: subsection (1) does not apply in relation to the additional tax payable as a result of the withdrawal of the relief, and
the relevant person is liable to pay that additional tax.

P2para.Text: In subsection (3) “the relevant person” means the person (other than the financial institution) who entered into the arrangements in question.

BlockAmendment.Text: In section 86 (payment of tax), after subsection (2) insert—

P2para.Text: Tax payable as a result of a withdrawal of relief under any of paragraphs 6D, 6F, 6G and 6H of Schedule 4A (higher rate: alternative finance arrangements) must be paid not later than the filing date for the return relating to the withdrawal (see section 81ZA(1)).

P1para.Text: In the table in section 122 (index of defined expressions), in second column of the entry for “settlement”, after “paragraph 1(1)” insert “(except as otherwise expressly provided)”.
The amendments made by paragraphs 1 to 7 have effect in relation to transactions with an effective date on or after the day on which this Act is passed.

P1group.Title: Transactions to which section 29 of the Scotland Act 2012 applies

P2para.Text: In relation to transactions in relation to which section 29 of the Scotland Act 2012 (disapplication of UK stamp duty land tax) has effect, FA 2003 as amended by this Schedule has effect subject to the following further amendments.
In section 81ZA, in subsection (6), in the definition of “alternative finance arrangements”, omit “72, 72A”.
In Schedule 4A—

P3para.Text: in paragraph 6A—

P4para.Text: in sub-paragraph (1)(a), omit “section 72 (land in Scotland sold to financial institution and leased to person)”,
omit sub-paragraph (2)(b),
in sub-paragraph (4), omit “, 72(3)”, and
in sub-paragraph (6), omit “, 72”,

P3para.Text: omit paragraph 6B,
in paragraph 6C—

P4para.Text: in sub-paragraph (1), omit “or 6B (“the modifying paragraph”)” and for “in the modifying paragraph” substitute “in paragraph 6A”, and
accordingly, in the heading omit “and 6B”,

P3para.Text: in paragraph 6D—

P4para.Text: in sub-paragraph (1), omit “or 6B(3)”,
in sub-paragraph (3)(a), omit “and (6)”,
in sub-paragraph (5)(b), omit “or 72(1)(c)”,
omit sub-paragraph (6), and
in sub-paragraph (7), in the definition of “relevant person”, omit “, 72(1), 72A(1)”,

P3para.Text: in paragraph 6E(4)(b), for “sub-paragraph (5)(a) or (6)(a) of paragraph 6D (as the case requires)” substitute “paragraph 6D(5)(a)”,
in paragraph 6F—

P4para.Text: in sub-paragraph (1), omit “or 6B(3)”, and
in sub-paragraph (7)(b), omit “, 72(1), 72A(1)”,

P3para.Text: in paragraph 6G—

P4para.Text: in sub-paragraph (1), omit “or 6B(3)”, and
in sub-paragraph (9)(b), omit “72(1), 72A(1)”, and

P3para.Text: in paragraph 6H—

P4para.Text: in sub-paragraph (1), omit “or 6B(3), and
in sub-paragraph (8)(b), omit “72(1), 72A(1)”.

TitleBlock.Title: Stamp duty land tax on leases

P1para.Text: Part 4 of FA 2003 (stamp duty land tax) is amended as follows.

P1group.Title: Leases that continue after a fixed term

P2para.Text: In Schedule 17A (further provisions about leases), paragraph 3 (leases that continue after a fixed term) is amended as follows.
In sub-paragraph (3)—

P3para.Text: after “continuation of the lease” insert “for a period (or further period) of one year”, and
in paragraph (a), for “that term” substitute “that one year period”.

P2para.Text: After that sub-paragraph insert—
Sub-paragraph (2) is subject to paragraph 3A.
In sub-paragraph (4), for the words from “the day” to the end substitute “the last day of the one year period for which the lease is continued or (as the case may be) further continued.”
After sub-paragraph (5) insert—
Where—

P3para.Text: a lease would be treated as continuing for a period (or further period) of one year under sub-paragraph (2), but
(ignoring that sub-paragraph) the lease actually terminates at a time during that period,

P2para.Text: the lease is to be treated as continuing under sub-paragraph (2) only until that time; and the references in sub-paragraphs (3) and (4) to that one year period are accordingly to be read as references to so much of that year as ends with that time.

P1para.Text: After that paragraph insert—

P2para.Text: This paragraph applies where—

P3para.Text: (ignoring this paragraph) paragraph 3 would apply to treat a lease (“the original lease”) as if it were a lease for a fixed term one year longer than the original term,
during that one year period the tenant under that lease is granted a new lease of the same or substantially the same premises,
the term of the new lease begins during that one year period, and
paragraph 9A (backdated lease granted to tenant holding over) does not apply.

P2para.Text: Paragraph 3 does not apply to treat the lease as continuing after the original fixed term.
The term of the new lease is treated for the purposes of this Part as beginning immediately after the original fixed term.

Any rent which, in the absence of this paragraph, would be payable under the original lease in respect of that one year period is to be treated as payable under the new lease (and paragraph 1A of Schedule 5 does not apply to it).

Where the fixed term of a lease has previously been extended (on one or more occasions) under paragraph 3, this paragraph applies as if references to the original term were references to the fixed term as previously so extended.

P1para.Text: In section 87 (interest on unpaid tax), in subsection (3)—

P3para.Text: after paragraph (aa) insert—

in the case of an amount payable under paragraph 3(3) of Schedule 17A (leases that continue after a fixed term) by reason of the continuation of a lease for a period (or further period) under paragraph 3(2) or (6) of that Schedule, the final day of the period (or further period),
in paragraph (ab) omit “3(3) or” and “leases that continue after a fixed term and”.

P1para.Text: In section 119 (meaning of “effective date” of a transaction), in subsection (2), at the appropriate place in the list insert—

P2para.Text: paragraph 3(4) of Schedule 17A (leases that continue after a fixed term),

P1group.Title: Agreement for lease and assignment of agreement for lease

P2para.Text: Schedule 17A is amended as follows.
In paragraph 12A (agreement for lease), for sub-paragraph (3) substitute—
Where a lease (“the actual lease”) is subsequently granted in pursuance of the agreement, the notional lease is to be treated for the purposes of this Part as if it were a lease granted—

P3para.Text: on the date the agreement was substantially performed,
for a term which begins with that date and ends at the end of the term of the actual lease, and
in consideration of the total rent payable over that term and any other consideration given for the notional lease or the actual lease.

P2para.Text: Where sub-paragraph (3) applies the grant of the actual lease is disregarded for the purposes of this Part except section 81A (return or further return in consequence of later linked transaction).
For the purposes of section 81A—

P3para.Text: the grant of the notional lease and the grant of the actual lease are linked (whether or not they would be linked by virtue of section 108),

the lessee under the actual lease (rather than the lessee under the notional lease) is liable for any tax or additional tax payable in respect of the notional lease as a result of sub-paragraph (3), and
the reference in section 81A(1)(a) to “the purchaser under the earlier transaction” is to be read, in relation to the notional lease, as a reference to the lessee under the actual lease.

P2para.Text: In paragraph 19 (missives of let)—

P3para.Text: for sub-paragraph (2) substitute—

P2para.Text: Where in Scotland there is a lease constituted by concluded missives of let (“the first lease”) and at some later time a lease is executed (“the second lease”), the first lease is to be treated for the purposes of this Part as if it were a lease granted—

P3para.Text: on the date the missives of let were concluded,
for a period which begins with that date and ends at the end of the period of the second lease, and
in consideration of the total rent payable over that period and any other consideration given for the first lease or the second lease.

P2para.Text: Where sub-paragraph (2) applies the grant of the second lease is disregarded for the purposes of this Part except section 81A (return or further return in consequence of later linked transaction).
For the purposes of section 81A—

P3para.Text: the grant of the first lease and the grant of the second lease are linked (whether or not they would be linked by virtue of section 108),

the lessee under the second lease (rather than the lessee under the first lease) is liable for any tax or additional tax payable in respect of the first lease lease as a result of sub-paragraph (2), and
the reference in section 81A(1)(a) to “the purchaser under the earlier transaction” is to be read, in relation to the first lease, as a reference to the lessee under the actual lease.
for sub-paragraph (4) substitute—

P2para.Text: Where sub-paragraph (3) applies and at some later time a lease (“the actual lease”) is executed, this Part applies as if the notional lease were a lease granted—

P3para.Text: on the date the agreement was substantially performed,
for a period which begins with that date and ends at the end of the period of the actual lease, and
in consideration of the total rent payable over that period and any other consideration given for the agreement or the actual lease.

P2para.Text: Where sub-paragraph (4) applies the grant of the second lease is disregarded for the purposes of this Part except section 81A (return or further return in consequence of later linked transaction).”
For the purposes of section 81A—

P3para.Text: the grant of the notional lease and the grant of the actual lease are linked (whether or not they would be linked by virtue of section 108),

the lessee under the actual lease (rather than the lessee under the notional lease) is liable for any tax or additional tax payable in respect of the notional lease as a result of sub-paragraph (4), and
the reference in section 81A(1)(a) to “the purchaser under the earlier transaction” is to be read, in relation to the notional lease, as a reference to the lessee under the actual lease.

P2para.Text: Accordingly, in Schedule 25 to FA 2006, paragraphs 4 and 5 are omitted.
In Schedule 17A, omit paragraphs 14 and 15 (abnormal increases in rent after fifth year).
Accordingly, the following are also repealed—

P3para.Text: in Schedule 25 to FA 2006, paragraphs 7, 8 and 9(5), and
in Schedule 3 to the Scotland Act 2012, paragraph 27(9).

P2para.Text: The amendments made by paragraph 2(2), (4) and (5) have effect in relation to any one year period for which a lease is continued, or further continued, which begins on or after the commencement day (including any period which would be one year but for paragraph 3(6) of Schedule 17A to FA 2003).
The amendments made by paragraphs 2(3), 3 and 5 have effect if the one year period mentioned in paragraph 3A(1)(b) of Schedule 17A to FA 2003 begins on or after the commencement day.

The amendments made by paragraph 4 have effect in relation to amounts payable in consequence of any period for which a lease is continued, or further continued, which begins on or after the commencement day.
The amendments made by paragraph 6 have effect if the effective date of the actual lease or, as the case may be, second lease falls on or after the commencement day.
The amendments made by paragraph 7 have effect in relation to any increase in rent that takes effect on or after the commencement day.
“The commencement day” means the day on which this Act is passed.

TitleBlock.Title: Climate change levy: supplies subject to carbon price support rates etc

Part.Title: Earlier provision not to have effect

P2para.Text: On and after 26 March 2013, Schedule 6 to FA 2000 (climate change levy) has effect as if neither—

P3para.Text: Schedule 20 to FA 2011, nor
Parts 1 and 2 of Schedule 32 to FA 2012,

P2para.Text: had ever been enacted.
Accordingly—

P3para.Text: in FA 2011, section 78 and Schedule 20 are omitted, and
in FA 2012, Parts 1 and 2 of Schedule 32 are omitted.

P2para.Text: The amendments made by sub-paragraph (2) are treated as having come into force on 26 March 2013.

Part.Title: New provision having effect from 1 April 2013

P1para.Text: Schedule 6 to FA 2000 (climate change levy) is amended as follows.
In paragraph 4 (definition of “taxable supply”) in sub-paragraph (2)(b) after “24” insert “, 24A, 24B, 24C, 42D”.
In paragraph 5 (supplies of electricity) after sub-paragraph (2) insert—

P2para.Text: Levy is chargeable on a supply of electricity if—

P3para.Text: the supply is made by an exempt unlicensed electricity supplier who is an auto-generator or who is of a description prescribed by regulations made by the Treasury,
